SBI PO prelims result expected to be released soon at sbi.co.in: Check steps to download scorecards here
The State Bank of India (SBI) is likely to announce the Probationary Officer (PO) Preliminary Exam 2025 results soon on its official website, sbi.co.in. The exam was conducted on August 2, 4, and 5 across the country. Successful candidates will proceed to the Main Examination, with SBI urging aspirants to regularly check official updates.
SBI PO prelims result expected to be released soon at sbi.co.in: Check steps to download scorecards here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsSBI PO prelims result expected to be released soon at sbi.co.in: Check steps to download scorecards hereTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultSBI PO prelims result expected to be released soon at sbi.co.in: Check steps to download scorecards hereTOI Education /  Aug 15, 2025, 09:34 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe State Bank of India (SBI) is likely to announce the Probationary Officer (PO) Preliminary Exam 2025 results soon on its official website, sbi.co.in. The exam was conducted on August 2, 4, and 5 across the country. Successful candidates will proceed to the Main Examination, with SBI urging aspirants to regularly check official updates. SBI PO prelims result 2025 expected soon SBI PO prelims result 2025 expected to be released soon: The State Bank of India (SBI) is expected to release the results of the Probationary Officer (PO) prelims exam 2025 soon on the official website. The nationwide Prelims were held on August 2, 4, and 5, attracting thousands of aspirants across multiple test centres.While the exact date for result declaration has not been confirmed, SBI typically releases results within weeks of the exam. Candidates have been urged to keep a close watch on the official SBI Careers portal — sbi.co.in — to avoid missing updates.Only those who clear the Prelims will move forward to the Main Examination, the next crucial stage in the high-stakes SBI PO recruitment process.SBI PO prelims results 2025: Steps to download scorecardsCandidates can follow the steps mentioned here to download scorecards from the official website once it is released:Visit the SBI Careers portal at sbi.co.in.Navigate to the Recruitment Results section.Locate “Probationary Officers (Advertisement No: CRPD/PO/2024-25/22)” under the Prelims results tab.Click on the link as provided here.Enter roll number/registration number and date of birth accurately.Click submit to view the result. The result will appear on the screen.Download and print the result for future reference, especially for the Mains exam registration.SBI PO prelims scorecard 2025: Details includedThe scorecard will include:Candidate details: Name, Roll/Registration Number, Date of Birth, Category.Exam details: Name, date, and shift/session of the exam.Section-wise scores: English, Quantitative Aptitude, and Reasoning Ability.Overall performance: Total marks obtained and maximum marks.Qualifying status: Confirmation of Main Exam eligibility.Cut-off marks: Category-wise section and overall cut-offs.Next stage: Main exam and beyondPrelims marks are qualifying in nature and do not contribute to the final merit list. Candidates who clear this stage will proceed to the Main Examination, which carries greater weight in the selection process. The Main Exam will be followed by the Group Exercise and Interview rounds, which collectively determine the final list of successful candidates for the prestigious SBI PO posts.Candidates are advised to stay tuned to the official website to get the latest updates of the SBI PO recruitment process.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousRubina Dilaik's powerful reality show lookstvIn pic: Radiant pictures of Pooja HegdeEntertainment5 human body parts we may no longer need in the futureLifestyleBollywood-approved ethnic sets that are perfect for Independence Day 2025Lifestyle10 Stunning ethnic looks of Megha Shettytv10 celeb-inspired Indian baby girl namesLifestyleOne's own enemy: 8 animals that get triggered by their own reflectionLifestyleIndependence Day 2025: 10 inspiring lines on Freedom that warm the heartLifestyleJanmashtami 2025: Ethnic Glam Lessons from Malavika MohananEntertainmentHow to build a balcony water garden with easy care stepsLifestyle Next123 Photostories  India at 79: PM Modi leads Independence Day celebrations - In pics5 unique and must-have desserts made with eggsIndependence Day 2025: Bollywood actors who have portrayed freedom fightersDid you know Sameera Reddy was the first Indian actress to have her own video game?From forest to ice: 6 animals that vanish into their habitatFreedom Trails: Cities where India’s independence was forgedFAFO parenting: 7 facts about the new parenting trendIndependence Day special: This Indian floral fabric threatened Europe’s textile industry5 post workout drinks for young adultsMargot Robbie’s barbie core to boss babe: Her best fashion moves123Hot PicksAsim MunirJapan Nikkei 225Nayara EnergyUS tariffs impactDonald Trump tariffsFord Electric Pickup TruckNew Income Tax Bill 2025Top TrendingLeBron JamesTom BradyDwyane WadeBrock Lesnar Net WorthPlayStation Plus GamesShedeur SanderStefon DiggsJoy TaylorNYU StudentsPatrick MahmoesTired of too many ads?go ad free nowTrending StoriesIn EducationEntire WebsiteCBSE issues public alert against fake agents peddling document services: Check details hereHow much you can earn in the US as a data scientistIBPS PO PET admit card 2025 released at ibps.in; CBSE issues public alert against fake agents peddling document services: Check details here
The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has warned students, parents, and stakeholders against fraudulent agents falsely claiming to offer quick services for duplicate mark sheets, certificates, and record corrections. CBSE clarified such operators are unauthorised and urged reliance only on its official website, stressing it will not be liable for losses from third-party dealings.
CBSE issues public alert against fake agents peddling document services: Check details here - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsCBSE issues public alert against fake agents peddling document services: Check details hereTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultCBSE issues public alert against fake agents peddling document services: Check details hereTOI Education /  Aug 15, 2025, 08:54 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has warned students, parents, and stakeholders against fraudulent agents falsely claiming to offer quick services for duplicate mark sheets, certificates, and record corrections. CBSE clarified such operators are unauthorised and urged reliance only on its official website, stressing it will not be liable for losses from third-party dealings.  The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has issued a public advisory cautioning students, parents, and educational stakeholders about fraudulent operators promising quick solutions for duplicate mark sheets, certificates, and corrections in official records.According to the CBSE Regional Office, Delhi (East), certain individuals and platforms are spreading “misleading and unauthentic claims” of facilitating these services. The Board has categorically denied any association with such agents.“Relying on these unofficial channels may lead to misinformation, financial loss, or other serious consequences,” the CBSE stated, urging people to remain alert and avoid engaging with such entities.Only official portal recognised for document servicesThe Board stressed that legitimate procedures for obtaining duplicate documents, making corrections, or availing other examination-related services are available exclusively through its official website — www.cbse.gov.in.In its advisory, the CBSE made it clear that it will not be held responsible for any loss, dispute, or inconvenience caused by transactions with unauthorised intermediaries.Public interest advisory to curb scamsThe CBSE underlined that the advisory was issued in the public interest to safeguard students and parents from falling victim to fraudulent claims. The warning follows increasing reports of scams in which vulnerable families, desperate for urgent documentation, were lured by false promises of faster service.By reiterating the need for verification and compliance with official procedures, the Board aims to curb the exploitation of students and their families by unverified sources.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousRubina Dilaik's powerful reality show lookstvIn pic: Radiant pictures of Pooja HegdeEntertainment5 human body parts we may no longer need in the futureLifestyleBollywood-approved ethnic sets that are perfect for Independence Day 2025Lifestyle10 Stunning ethnic looks of Megha Shettytv10 celeb-inspired Indian baby girl namesLifestyleOne's own enemy: 8 animals that get triggered by their own reflectionLifestyleIndependence Day 2025: 10 inspiring lines on Freedom that warm the heartLifestyleJanmashtami 2025: Ethnic Glam Lessons from Malavika MohananEntertainmentHow to build a balcony water garden with easy care stepsLifestyle Next123 Photostories  India at 79: PM Modi leads Independence Day celebrations - In pics5 unique and must-have desserts made with eggsIndependence Day 2025: Bollywood actors who have portrayed freedom fightersDid you know Sameera Reddy was the first Indian actress to have her own video game?Freedom Trails: Cities where India’s independence was forgedFrom forest to ice: 6 animals that vanish into their habitatFAFO parenting: 7 facts about the new parenting trendIndependence Day special: This Indian floral fabric threatened Europe’s textile industry5 post workout drinks for young adultsMargot Robbie’s barbie core to boss babe: Her best fashion moves123Hot PicksAsim MunirJapan Nikkei 225Nayara EnergyUS tariffs impactDonald Trump tariffsFord Electric Pickup TruckNew Income Tax Bill 2025Top TrendingLeBron JamesTom BradyDwyane WadeBrock Lesnar Net WorthPlayStation Plus GamesShedeur SanderStefon DiggsJoy TaylorMyles GarrettPatrick MahmoesTired of too many ads?go ad free nowTrending StoriesIn EducationEntire WebsiteHow much you can earn in the US as a data scientistIBPS PO PET admit card 2025 released at ibps.in; US investigates Kansas schools over gender identity policies: What you need to know about the Title IX and FERPA fallout
The US Department of Education has opened investigations into four Kansas school districts over alleged violations of Title IX and FERPA. The inquiry follows complaints that the districts allow students access to sports and facilities based on gender identity and restrict parental access to related information. Officials cite concerns over legal non-compliance and potential breaches of parental rights. Investigations are ongoing and could result in the withdrawal of federal funding if violations are confirmed.
US investigates Kansas schools over gender identity policies: What you need to know about the Title IX and FERPA fallout - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsUS investigates Kansas schools over gender identity policies: What you need to know about the Title IX and FERPA falloutTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultUS investigates Kansas schools over gender identity policies: What you need to know about the Title IX and FERPA falloutSanjay Sharma / TOI Education /  Aug 15, 2025, 02:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe US Department of Education has opened investigations into four Kansas school districts over alleged violations of Title IX and FERPA. The inquiry follows complaints that the districts allow students access to sports and facilities based on gender identity and restrict parental access to related information. Officials cite concerns over legal non-compliance and potential breaches of parental rights. Investigations are ongoing and could result in the withdrawal of federal funding if violations are confirmed. Kansas schools face US probe over gender identity and privacy policies. (AI Image) The US Department of Education has launched investigations into four Kansas school districts over allegations that their gender identity policies may violate federal laws. The Office for Civil Rights (OCR) and the Student Privacy Policy Office (SPPO) are examining the conduct of Topeka Public Schools, Shawnee Public Schools, Olathe Public Schools, and Kansas City, Kansas Public Schools.The investigation follows a complaint filed by the Defense of Freedom Institute (DFI), which alleges that the districts' policies allow students to participate in sports and access facilities based on gender identity rather than biological sex. The complaint also claims that school officials are prohibited from informing parents of a student’s transgender status without the student’s consent.Investigations focus on Title IX and FERPA complianceThe Department of Education is investigating whether these policies breach Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 and the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). Title IX prohibits discrimination based on sex in educational programmes receiving federal financial assistance, while FERPA protects the privacy of student education records and grants parents the right to access and control certain disclosures of this information.According to the Department, violations of either law can result in the termination of federal funding to the school districts involved.Kansas Attorney General and Education Secretary respondKansas Attorney General Kris Kobach submitted a letter to US Secretary of Education Linda McMahon, expressing concern about the districts’ policies and potential violations of federal law. Kobach stated, “Title IX was enacted to protect the rights of girls to equal educational opportunity and safety. Kansas had to sue and defeat the Biden Administration in federal court to stop them from dismantling Title IX.”In response, Secretary McMahon noted that her office would “vigorously investigate these matters to ensure these practices come to an end.” She added, “The Kansas districts’ alleged behaviour of allowing gender ideology to run amok in their schools is an affront not only to the law, but to the sound judgement we expect from our educational leaders.”Department guidance on parental rights and student privacyIn March, the SPPO issued a Dear Colleague Letter (DCL) to state superintendents, reminding them of their compliance obligations under FERPA. The letter described policies that hide a child’s gender identity from parents as a “priority concern.” Secretary McMahon also included a cover letter stating that “by natural right and moral authority, parents are the primary protectors of their children.”FERPA provides parents with the right to access their children’s education records, request amendments, and limit the disclosure of personally identifiable information, with specific exceptions. Any instruction to staff to withhold information about a child’s gender identity from parents may infringe on these rights.Potential consequences for districts under investigationShould the Department of Education find that the districts are in violation of Title IX or FERPA, the consequences may include the withdrawal of federal funding. The investigations are ongoing, and the Department has not yet announced any findings or enforcement actions.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!About the AuthorSanjay SharmaSanjay Sharma is a seasoned journalist with over two decades of experience in the media industry. Currently serving as Assistant Editor - Education at TimesofIndia.com, he specializes in education-related content, including board results, job notifications, and studying abroad. Since joining TOI in 2006, he has played a pivotal role in expanding the platform’s digital presence and spearheading major education events. Previously, Sanjay held leadership positions in sports journalism, covering high-profile events such as the Cricket World Cup and Olympics. He holds a PG Diploma in Journalism from Bharatiya Vidya Bhawan and is proficient in various content management systems.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous5 How much you can earn in the US as a data scientist
Data scientists in the US earn an average annual salary of $156,790, according to 365 Data Science’s 2025 report based on Glassdoor data. The US Bureau of Labor Statistics reports a median salary of $112,590 as of May 2024, with projections showing 36% employment growth by 2031. Senior roles have seen an 11.7% salary increase. Key skills in demand include data visualisation, predictive modelling, and statistical analysis, with tech unemployment remaining around 2%.
How much you can earn in the US as a data scientist - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsHow much you can earn in the US as a data scientistTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultHow much you can earn in the US as a data scientistSanjay Sharma / TOI Education / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 00:14 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeData scientists in the US earn an average annual salary of $156,790, according to 365 Data Science’s 2025 report based on Glassdoor data. The US Bureau of Labor Statistics reports a median salary of $112,590 as of May 2024, with projections showing 36% employment growth by 2031. Senior roles have seen an 11.7% salary increase. Key skills in demand include data visualisation, predictive modelling, and statistical analysis, with tech unemployment remaining around 2%. Data scientist salaries in the US reach $156,790 in 2025, BLS and industry data show. (AI Image) The data science sector in the US continues to attract attention for its high-paying roles, robust job market, and projected growth. According to a 2025 industry report published by 365 Data Science, data science has secured a place among the top three career choices in terms of compensation. Data from 365 Data Science, based on self-reported figures from Glassdoor, shows that the average total salary of a data scientist in the US, including additional pay, is $156,790. This figure reflects the national average and may vary depending on factors such as experience, location, and industry.US data scientists lead global salary rankingsAccording to the same report from 365 Data Science, data scientists in the US earn significantly more than their counterparts in other key markets. The comparison of average total salaries across selected countries is summarised below:CountryAverage Total Salary (USD)US156790Germany85115UK79978Canada73607India16759All values are presented in US dollars. The report highlights that while the salaries appear higher, regional purchasing power should also be considered. It notes that “a dollar in New York has a different purchasing power than a dollar in Mumbai or Eastern Europe,” as stated by 365 Data Science.US government data provides additional contextIn addition to industry surveys, official data from the US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) provides further insight into data scientist salaries.According to the BLS, the median annual wage for data scientists in the US was approximately $112,590 in May 2024.Earlier BLS data from 2020 placed the mean (average) salary at around $103,930. However, more recent aggregated salary sources suggest actual averages can be higher, typically cited between $104,000 and $157,000, depending on variables such as education, experience, and region.Strong job growth predicted through 2031The 2025 IT Salary Guide by Motion Recruitment outlines ongoing growth in the data science job market. Citing data from the US Bureau of Labor Statistics, the guide states that employment for data scientists is projected to grow 36% by 2031, making it one of the fastest-growing roles in the technology industry.The guide further notes that senior-level data scientists have seen a 11.7% year-on-year salary increase, one of the largest salary hikes across all tech positions.Demand remains high across industriesData science remains a critical field within the US tech landscape, with a steady rise in job postings. As reported by Motion Recruitment, companies are actively seeking professionals with expertise in data visualisation, statistical analysis, data mining, and predictive modelling. The Motion Recruitment guide adds that tech unemployment remains low, hovering around 2%, which contributes to a competitive hiring environment. It further states that “data scientists are still the talk of the tech industry,” with businesses facing challenges in finding qualified candidates.• Data visualisation• Statistical analysis• Data mining• Predictive modellingThe 2025 guide states that “data scientists are still the talk of the tech industry,” referring to the continued shortage of highly skilled candidates.Educational background and career planning considerationsAccording to 365 Data Science, 2025 Salary Overview, professionals considering a career in data science should account for varying factors—such as geographic location, level of education, and company size—before entering the field. The platform advises that understanding real-world salary data is essential to avoid unrealistic expectations and to plan a successful data science career.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. IBPS PO PET admit card 2025 released at ibps.in; here's steps to download
IBPS PO admit card 2025: The Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) has released the IBPS PO PET Admit Card 2025 for the preliminary examination at ibps.in. Candidates appearing for the CRP PO/MT-XV exam can download their admit card using their registration details. The online exam will be held on August 17, 23, and 24, 2025, with a total of 100 objective-type questions. Admit cards will remain available until August 24, 2025, and negative marking will apply.

Candidates appearing for the CRP PO/MT-XV exam can download their admit card using their registration details. The online exam will be held on August 17, 23, and 24, 2025, with a total of 100 objective-type questions. Admit cards will remain available until August 24, 2025, and negative marking will apply. IBPS PO PET admit card 2025 available till 24 August IBPS PO admit card 2025: The Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) has released the Pre-Examination Training (PET) admit card for the Probationary Officers (PO) Preliminary Examination 2025. Candidates registered for the IBPS PO/Management Trainee (CRP PO/MT-XV) recruitment can now download their PET admit card from the official website — ibps.in.The IBPS PO Preliminary Examination will be conducted in online mode. As per the official notification, the admit card will be available for download until August 24, 2025. Candidates are advised to download their call letter before the last date to avoid technical issues.Admit card released for IBPS PO/MT-XV preliminary examThe IBPS PO Prelims Examination is being conducted for the recruitment of Probationary Officers under CRP PO/MT-XV. The preliminary exam is scheduled to take place on August 17, 23, and 24, 2025.The exam will be conducted in online mode and will consist of objective-type questions. A total of 100 questions will be asked in the paper — 30 questions from English Language, 35 from Quantitative Aptitude, and 35 from Reasoning Ability. The total duration of the exam will be one hour.Important instructions and negative markingCandidates are required to bring a printed copy of the admit card to the examination centre, along with valid photo identification. The admit card will contain essential information including the exam date, time, venue, and candidate's roll number.Negative marking will be applicable in the exam. One-fourth (0.25) marks will be deducted for each incorrect answer marked by the candidate. No deduction will be made for unanswered questions.Steps to download IBPS PO PET admit card 2025 at ibps.inCandidates can follow the steps below to download the IBPS PO PET admit card 2025:Step 1: Visit the official IBPS website at ibps.in.Step 2: On the homepage, click on the link titled “IBPS Online Pre-Examination for (CRP PO/MT-XV) Admit Card 2025.”Step 3: Enter your registration number/roll number and date of birth/password in the login section.Step 4: The admit card will appear on the screen.Step 5: Download and take a printout of the admit card for use on the exam day.Direct link to download the IBPS PO PET admit card 2025 from ibps.inCall letter available till August 24, 2025The admit card will be accessible on the official portal only until August 24, 2025. Candidates are advised to download their admit card well in advance of the exam date.For further updates and detailed instructions, candidates must refer to the official website of IBPS.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Newsom calls for Harvard president's resignation over Trump deal: Here's why critics say the agreement is surrender, not compromise
California Governor Gavin Newsom has called for Harvard University President Alan Garber's resignation amid reports of a $500 million settlement with the Trump administration. Critics argue the deal represents surrender, not compromise, as it may set a precedent for further federal demands on universities. Harvard's initial resistance has drawn internal opposition and public support, while Newsom vows to oppose similar demands targeting other Californian institutions such as UCLA.
Newsom calls for Harvard president's resignation over Trump deal: Here's why critics say the agreement is surrender, not compromise - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsNewsom calls for Harvard president's resignation over Trump deal: Here's why critics say the agreement is surrender, not compromiseTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultNewsom calls for Harvard president's resignation over Trump deal: Here's why critics say the agreement is surrender, not compromiseSanjay Sharma / TOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 22:27 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeCalifornia Governor Gavin Newsom has called for Harvard University President Alan Garber's resignation amid reports of a $500 million settlement with the Trump administration. Critics argue the deal represents surrender, not compromise, as it may set a precedent for further federal demands on universities. Harvard's initial resistance has drawn internal opposition and public support, while Newsom vows to oppose similar demands targeting other Californian institutions such as UCLA. Harvard faces backlash as Newsom demands resignation amid Trump administration settlement talks. (ANI Photo) California Governor Gavin C. Newsom has called for the resignation of Harvard University President Alan M. Garber over reports that the University is nearing a settlement with the Trump administration. Newsom's remarks were posted on social media platform X, where he criticised Harvard's ongoing negotiations with the White House regarding the restoration of research funding."An absolute failure of leadership that will have demonstrable impacts to higher education across our country," Newsom wrote, as reported by The Harvard Crimson. He added, "He should be ashamed," referring to Garber. Newsom's statement follows increasing criticism from Democratic politicians and affiliates who oppose any settlement with the current US administration.Harvard reportedly in final stages of deal with Trump administrationHarvard University and the Trump administration resumed negotiations in June to restore billions of dollars in research funding. According to reports from The New York Times and The Wall Street Journal, the White House is demanding a settlement of approximately $500 million, and discussions are reportedly in the final stages.Newsom's post came amid broader concerns over similar deals between the federal government and Ivy League institutions. Columbia University and Brown University reached settlements earlier this summer, with Columbia agreeing to pay $200 million and submit to federal oversight, including restrictions on student protests and a review of academic programmes. Brown committed $50 million to a workforce development initiative in Rhode Island.As reported by The Harvard Crimson, Democratic lawmakers, including 14 Harvard alumni in Congress, warned the University of a potential investigation should it proceed with the agreement. Critics argue that Harvard's compliance would set a precedent for future federal demands on academic institutions.Newsom joins other Democrats in opposing dealNewsom, considered a potential Democratic presidential candidate for 2028, joined a growing number of politicians expressing opposition to the deal. In a separate post quoted by The Harvard Crimson, Newsom wrote, "You don't work with Donald Trump — only FOR Donald Trump," and added, "Looks like Harvard has chosen to surrender."Newsom's office did not respond to a request for comment, and Harvard officials have declined to comment on the situation, according to The Harvard Crimson.Trump administration also targets California universityNewsom's statements were also tied to reports that the Trump administration is seeking a $1 billion settlement from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), in exchange for the restoration of over $500 million in research funding. A federal judge has since ordered the funding to be reinstated.As per The Harvard Crimson, Newsom responded, "CALIFORNIA WILL NEVER BEND THE KNEE," and has threatened to initiate legal action, adding to the 37 lawsuits California has filed against the administration.Harvard's initial resistance and growing internal oppositionEarlier in the year, Harvard refused demands from the Trump administration and subsequently filed two lawsuits. This resistance was publicly supported by the Cambridge City Council and Massachusetts Democrats, according to The Harvard Crimson.However, reports from The Harvard Crimson indicate that internal divisions persist. While some faculty members view a potential agreement as pragmatic, others have voiced strong opposition. Groups such as Crimson Courage and Students for Freedom have circulated open letters urging the University to reject political interference. Crimson Courage's letter stated, "We cannot stand for ‘veritas' if we refuse to stand up for truth when the moment demands it."Harvard's chapter of the American Association of University Professors also warned, "Extortion payments are rarely a one-time affair," as reported by The Harvard Crimson.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Since joining TOI in 2006, he has played a pivotal role in expanding the platform’s digital presence and spearheading major education events. Previously, Sanjay held leadership positions in sports journalism, covering high-profile events such as the Cricket World Cup and Olympics. SSC releases final answer keys for SI Paper II and stenographer marks 2024 at ssc.gov.in; check here
SSC SI answer key 2024: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has published the final answer keys and response sheets for the SI in Delhi Police and CAPFs Examination, 2024 (Paper II), and the final marks for the Stenographer Grade C & D Examination, 2024. Both updates were released on August 14, 2025, via the official SSC website. Candidates can access their documents by logging in with their Registered ID and Password within the specified timeframes for each examination.

Both updates were released on August 14, 2025, via the official SSC website. Candidates can access their documents by logging in with their Registered ID and Password within the specified timeframes for each examination. SSC releases SI Paper II answer keys and stenographer marks 2024 at SSC.gov.in SSC SI answer key 2024: The Staff Selection Commission (SSC) has released the final answer keys for the Sub-Inspector (SI) in Delhi Police and Central Armed Police Forces (CAPFs) Examination, 2024 (Paper II), along with the response sheets of candidates. In a separate notice, SSC has also published the final marks of all candidates—qualified and non-qualified—for the Stenographer Grade C & D Examination, 2024.Both updates were issued on August 14, 2025, and are now available on the official SSC website, ssc.gov.in. Candidates can log in using their registered credentials to access and download the relevant documents within the specified timelines. The final answer keys and candidates’ response sheets for the SI in Delhi Police and CAPFs Examination (Paper II) have been uploaded following the declaration of the results on August 8, 2025. In a separate notice, SSC has also published the final marks of both qualified and non-qualified candidates for the Stenographer Grade C & D Examination, 2024, after the final results were announced on July 11, 2025.Final answer keys and response sheets available for SI paper IIAccording to the official notice (No. HQ-C1208/1/2024-C1/2), the final answer keys along with individual response sheets for Paper II of the SI in Delhi Police and CAPFs Examination, 2024, have been made available on the SSC portal from August 14, 2025 (06:00 PM).Candidates can access and download their answer keys and response sheets until August 29, 2025 (06:00 PM) by logging in with their registered credentials. After this deadline, the documents will no longer be accessible. The marks of both qualified and non-qualified candidates in this examination will also be published shortly on the Commission’s website.SSC uploads final marks for stenographer grade C & D examination 2024As per the notice (File No. E/7/2024-C-2-Section), SSC has uploaded the final marks of all candidates who appeared for the Stenographer Grade C & D Examination, 2024. The marks are accessible from August 14, 2025 (06:00 PM) to September 13, 2025 (06:00 PM).Candidates must log in using their Registered ID and Password on the official SSC website to view or download their scorecards. They are advised to take a printout of the marks during the given time frame, as no copies will be available after the specified period.Steps to check and download SSC SI final answer keys and stenographer marksStep 1: Visit the official SSC website at ssc.gov.in.Step 2: Click on the login link relevant to the respective examination.Step 3: Enter your Registered ID and Password to access your dashboard.Step 4: For SI Paper II, click on the link to view final answer keys and response sheets. For stenographer results, click on the marks link.Step 5: Download and print your final answer key/response sheet or scorecard, as applicable.Availability and login informationFor the SI Paper II examination, the final answer keys and response sheets are available through the login portal at:https://ssc.digialm.com:443//EForms/configuredHtml/32874/89701/login.htmlBoth documents—the answer keys for SI Paper II and the marks for Stenographer Grade C & D—must be downloaded within their respective deadlines, after which they will be inaccessible.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. BSPHCL Technician Grade III answer key 2025 released at bsphcl.co.in; check direct link here
The Bihar State Power Holding Company Limited (BSPHCL) has released the Technician Grade III answer key 2025 on its official website, bsphcl.co.in. Candidates can download the provisional answer key using their login credentials and raise objections online if needed. The recruitment exam was held to fill 2,156 posts. BSPHCL will review objections before releasing the final answer key and announcing the results for the Technician Grade III vacancies.

Candidates can download the provisional answer key using their login credentials and raise objections online if needed. The recruitment exam was held to fill 2,156 posts. BSPHCL will review objections before releasing the final answer key and announcing the results for the Technician Grade III vacancies. BSPHCL Technician Grade III answer key 2025 released at bsphcl.co.in BSPHCL Technician Grade III answer key 2025: The Bihar State Power Holding Company Limited (BSPHCL) has officially released the Technician Grade III answer key 2025 on its website, bsphcl.co.in. Candidates who appeared for the exam can now access and download the provisional answer key in PDF format using their login credentials. This release allows candidates to verify their answers and raise objections, if necessary, within the stipulated timeframe.The recruitment exam for the Technician Grade III posts was conducted across Bihar from July 11 to July 22, 2025. A total of 2,156 vacancies are to be filled through this recruitment drive. The organisation has activated the link to download the answer key and to submit objections, providing transparency in the evaluation process.How to download the BSPHCL Technician Grade III answer key 2025Candidates can follow these steps to check and download the BSPHCL Technician Grade III answer key 2025:Step 1: Visit the official BSPHCL website at bsphcl.co.in.Step 2: On the homepage, locate and click the link titled “Inviting objection against model answer (Tech.Gr.-III, ENN-05/2024).”Step 3: Enter your application number, password, and the displayed captcha code in the respective fields.Step 4: Click the submit button to access the answer key.Step 5: Verify the details such as name, exam centre, and date, then download and print the answer key for future reference.Direct link to download the BSPHCL Technician Grade III answer key 2025Details of BSPHCL Technician Grade III recruitmentThe recruitment exam was conducted by BSPHCL to fill 2,156 Technician Grade III posts. Candidates appearing for the exam were provided the provisional answer key to cross-check their answers before the final evaluation. The provisional answer key enables candidates to raise objections in case of discrepancies or errors.The organisation will review all objections submitted online with the help of an expert panel. After considering these challenges, BSPHCL will release the final answer key. The results for the Technician Grade III posts will be declared after the final answer key is published. It is important to note that no objections can be raised against the final answer key.What's next after the answer key release?Following the evaluation of all objections, the final answer key will be issued by BSPHCL. Candidates are advised to keep a close watch on the official website for updates regarding the final answer key and the result announcement. Using the login credentials will be necessary throughout this process.For further details and to download the BSPHCL Technician Grade III answer key 2025, candidates should visit bsphcl.co.in.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. 15-year-old Los Angeles student wrongly detained at gunpoint: How is LAUSD protecting its schools from immigration raids?
A 15-year-old Los Angeles student with disabilities was wrongly detained at gunpoint outside Arleta High School by immigration agents in a case of mistaken identity, sparking outrage and prompting LAUSD to bolster safety measures. The district has introduced safe zones, virtual schooling, legal aid, and family support programs to protect immigrant students and address trauma-induced absenteeism and anxiety.
15-year-old Los Angeles student wrongly detained at gunpoint: How is LAUSD protecting its schools from immigration raids? - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNews15-year-old Los Angeles student wrongly detained at gunpoint: How is LAUSD protecting its schools from immigration raids?TrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims Result15-year-old Los Angeles student wrongly detained at gunpoint: How is LAUSD protecting its schools from immigration raids?TOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 20:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeA 15-year-old Los Angeles student with disabilities was wrongly detained at gunpoint outside Arleta High School by immigration agents in a case of mistaken identity, sparking outrage and prompting LAUSD to bolster safety measures. The district has introduced safe zones, virtual schooling, legal aid, and family support programs to protect immigrant students and address trauma-induced absenteeism and anxiety.  A routine school registration turned into a flashpoint over immigration enforcement in Los Angeles recently, when a 15-year-old boy with significant disabilities was allegedly detained at gunpoint outside Arleta High School. According to Los Angeles Unified School District (LAUSD) officials, the incident unfolded as federal agents from the Department of Homeland Security approached the family of a female student who was registering at the school.“Today, unidentified immigration agents handcuffed, detained, and drew their guns on a BD6 student outside Arleta High School in an alleged case of mistaken identity,” LAUSD Board Member Kelly Gonez said in a statement. “Such actions — violently detaining a child just outside a public school — are absolutely reprehensible and should have no place in our country.”The boy was ultimately released at the scene. According to media reports, he is a student at San Fernando High School and had gone to Arleta High only to accompany a family member for registration, according to media reports. The campus falls within LAUSD’s Board District 6, which covers the eastern San Fernando Valley and is represented by Board Member Kelly Gonez. For LAUSD, the detention was more than an isolated enforcement action; it was a wake-up call to reinforce its role as a protector of vulnerable students. So, LSAUD is strengthening its safety measures to keep school kids safe. Here is how.Safe zones and virtual schoolsIn response to incidents such as this, LAUSD has strengthened safety protocols to create “safe zones” at and around school campuses. The district has established rapid-response protocols to address any future encounters with immigration personnel. These measures are designed to protect students from undue stress or disruption while on or near school grounds.LAUSD also continues to offer virtual schooling options for students affected by immigration enforcement. By enabling online learning, the district ensures continuity in education for students whose families may feel apprehensive about attending in-person classes. Enrollment in these virtual programs has reportedly increased in recent months, reflecting both the demand for alternative learning options and the anxiety that students and families are experiencing.Support for familiesBeyond physical safety, LAUSD has introduced a suite of initiatives to support the emotional and legal needs of immigrant families. These include:A 24/7 family hotline that provides assistance with immigration and mental health concerns.Legal referrals as part of the district’s 2025 “We Are One” campaign, which aims to actively involve immigrant families in school affairs.The “We Have Rights” empowerment campaign, offering guidance on common immigration enforcement encounters through animated resources in seven languages.Weekly workshops beginning August 22 to educate students and families on their legal rights and to provide practical support in navigating enforcement situations.These initiatives are part of LAUSD’s broader effort to ensure that immigrant families feel included, supported, and informed within the school community.The new lesson plan in America’s schools: FearRecent immigration enforcement policies under the Trump administration — marked by ambiguity over who will be arrested and how long they may be detained — are fueling chronic anxiety among students. This anxiety, according to a July report by psychiatric researchers at the University of California, Riverside, and New York University, has been linked to absenteeism, classroom disengagement, and heightened emotional distress. The researchers wrote that such fears have driven some students “to avoid school or withdraw from public life.”While the report underscores schools’ importance in identifying and supporting students’ mental health needs early, it also warns that they can become sites where immigrant youth “experience trauma-related avoidance, disengagement, or behavioral challenges.”TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. AP EAMCET 2025 final allotment result out; check your status at eapcet-sche.aptonline.in
AP EAMCET 2025 result: The Andhra Pradesh State Council of Higher Education (APSCHE) has announced the AP EAMCET 2025 final allotment result on the official website eapcet-sche.aptonline.in. Candidates can check their seat allotment status for engineering and pharmacy courses using their hall ticket number and date of birth. Allotted candidates must report to their colleges by August 20, 2025, with required documents. A spot round counselling will be conducted if seats remain vacant after this phase.

Candidates can check their seat allotment status for engineering and pharmacy courses using their hall ticket number and date of birth. Allotted candidates must report to their colleges by August 20, 2025, with required documents. A spot round counselling will be conducted if seats remain vacant after this phase. AP EAMCET 2025 final allotment result out  AP EAMCET 2025 result: The Andhra Pradesh State Council of Higher Education (APSCHE) has released the final phase seat allotment result for the Andhra Pradesh Engineering, Agriculture and Medical Common Entrance Test (AP EAMCET) 2025. The results are now available on the official website at eapcet-sche.aptonline.in. Candidates who appeared for the exam can check their allotment status and download their seat allotment letter from the portal.The seat allotment list covers admissions to engineering and pharmacy courses for the 2025 academic session. Candidates allotted seats must complete the admission formalities by reporting to their respective colleges before the deadline. Allotment status can be verified using candidates’ hall ticket number and date of birth.How to check the AP EAMCET 2025 final allotment resultCandidates can follow the steps below to check and download their AP EAMCET 2025 final seat allotment result:Step 1: Visit the official website at eapcet-sche.aptonline.in or directly access the AP EAMCET 2025 portal.Step 2: On the homepage, click on the link labelled ‘AP EAMCET 2025 seat allotment’.Step 3: Enter the required login credentials, including your KEAM 2025 hall ticket number and date of birth.Step 4: Press the ‘Submit’ button to view your allotment status.Step 5: Download and save the seat allotment letter for future reference.Important details for candidates after seat allotmentCandidates who have been allotted seats must report to their respective colleges by August 20, 2025, with all necessary documents to complete the admission process. The documents required include the AP EAMCET rank card, hall ticket, proof of date of birth such as SSC or equivalent certificate, memorandum of marks for intermediate or equivalent, transfer certificate, and study certificate from class VI to intermediate.Direct link to check and download the AP EAMCET 2025 final seat allotment result onlineOther essential documents include the EWS certificate valid for the academic year 2025-26, residence certificate, Andhra Pradesh residence certificate, integrated community certificate, income certificate, and local status certificate where applicable.Spot round counselling if seats remain vacantIf any seats remain vacant after the final allotment round, APSCHE will conduct a spot round counselling session to fill the remaining seats. Candidates are advised to regularly check the official website for updates regarding this additional counselling phase.All candidates must ensure that they follow the guidelines carefully and report to their allotted institutions within the stipulated timeline to confirm their admission under the AP EAMCET 2025 counselling process.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. UPSC CSE main 2025 admit card: Key details to check before August 22 exam
UPSC has released the CSE Main 2025 admit card on upsc.gov.in for the exam scheduled on August 22. Candidates must carefully verify details such as name, photograph, roll number, exam centre address, and subject codes. Discrepancies should be reported to the UPSC helpdesk immediately. Carrying a printed admit card and a valid photo ID is compulsory. Candidates must follow all exam-day instructions and avoid bringing prohibited items such as mobile phones and smartwatches.

Candidates must carefully verify details such as name, photograph, roll number, exam centre address, and subject codes. Discrepancies should be reported to the UPSC helpdesk immediately. Carrying a printed admit card and a valid photo ID is compulsory. Candidates must follow all exam-day instructions and avoid bringing prohibited items such as mobile phones and smartwatches. UPSC CSE main 2025 admit card: Key details to check and how to report errors UPSC CSE main hall ticket 2025: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has issued the admit card for the Civil Services Examination (CSE) Main 2025 on its official website, upsc.gov.in. All candidates scheduled to appear for the examination on August 22 must download and carefully review their admit cards to ensure that the information printed is accurate and complete.Failure to verify and correct discrepancies in the admit card may lead to issues on exam day, including denial of entry into the examination hall. UPSC has advised candidates to read the admit card thoroughly and report any errors immediately.Key details to verify on the UPSC CSE main 2025 admit cardOnce downloaded, candidates must cross-check the following information on their UPSC CSE Main 2025 admit card:Field on Admit CardWhat to CheckCandidate’s nameMust match the name used during registration and on official IDPhotograph and signatureShould be clearly visible and not blurred or distortedRoll numberEnsure the roll number is correct and corresponds with the UPSC registrationExam centre addressVerify the full address and locate the venue in advanceDate and time of examinationConfirm the exam date as August 22 and note the reporting timeSubject/paper detailsCheck which paper(s) you are scheduled to appear forCovid-19 instructions (if any)Follow any health-related guidelines mentionedInstructions sectionRead all rules regarding what to carry, what is prohibited, and dress codeHow to report discrepanciesIn case of any mismatch or incorrect detail in the admit card—such as errors in personal information, unclear photograph, or incorrect exam centre—candidates should immediately contact the UPSC helpdesk. Issues can be reported via email at helpdesk@upsc.gov.in or through the official helpline numbers available on the UPSC website.Documents required on the exam dayCandidates must bring the following documents to be allowed entry into the exam centre:• A printed copy of the UPSC CSE Main 2025 admit card• An original photo ID card (Aadhaar, PAN, Passport, or Voter ID) that matches the details on the admit cardThe name and photograph on the ID must match exactly with those on the admit card. Entry will not be permitted in the absence of either document.Instructions for exam day complianceThe admit card includes detailed instructions about exam hall protocol, reporting time, permitted stationery, and items that are not allowed. Candidates are reminded that mobile phones, smartwatches, and other electronic devices are strictly prohibited. UPSC does not provide lockers or storage facilities, so candidates are advised to avoid bringing valuables to the exam venue.Print multiple copies and store safelyIt is advisable to print at least two copies of the admit card. One copy should be carried to the exam, while the other should be stored safely as a backup. Avoid folding or damaging the printed admit card, and consider keeping a digital copy as an additional safeguard.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Independence Day 2025 quiz for students: Try this MCQ challenge on the freedom movement
As India approaches its 79th Independence Day in 2025, this quiz revisits the nation’s journey to freedom with ten thoughtfully chosen questions. Covering key historical figures, iconic symbols, and landmark events, the quiz encourages readers to reflect on India's enduring legacy of courage and unity. It's a concise and engaging way to celebrate national pride while deepening one’s understanding of India's fight for independence.

It's a concise and engaging way to celebrate national pride while deepening one’s understanding of India's fight for independence. India's 79th Independence Day quiz 2025: Try this MCQ challenge on the freedom movement As India approaches the 79th anniversary of its independence on 15 August 2025, it is a fitting time to reflect on the remarkable journey that led to the nation's freedom. From decades of resistance to the eventual transfer of power, India’s struggle for independence was marked by extraordinary resilience, unity, and courage.This quiz invites students to explore the critical moments, influential figures, and enduring symbols associated with India's freedom movement. Whether you're brushing up on history or testing what you already know, these questions aim to deepen your understanding of India’s past and the spirit of its people.Independence Day quiz: How well do you know India’s history?1. On which date is India’s Independence Day observed each year?a) 14 Augustb) 26 Januaryc) 15 Augustd) 4 July2. Who served as the first Prime Minister of independent India?a) Vallabhbhai Patelb) Jawaharlal Nehruc) Dr. B. R. Ambedkard) Indira Gandhi3. Which year marked the end of British colonial rule in India?a) 1945b) 1950c) 1947d) 19304. The Indian National Flag is hoisted annually from which iconic location on Independence Day?a) India Gateb) Gateway of Indiac) Red Fortd) Rashtrapati Bhavan5. What are the official colours of the Indian National Flag?a) Saffron, white, green, and navy blueb) Red, white, and greenc) Orange, blue, and whited) Yellow, red, and green6. Who was the designer behind the Indian National Flag?a) Bhagat Singhb) Rabindranath Tagorec) Pingali Venkayyad) Jawaharlal Nehru7. What is the name of India’s national anthem?a) Saare Jahan Se Achhab) Jana Gana Manac) Vande Mataramd) Jai Hind8. Who composed the Indian National Anthem?a) Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyayb) Rabindranath Tagorec) Subramania Bharatid) Sarojini Naidu9. What is the meaning of the three horizontal colours on the Indian flag?a) Strength, peace, and prosperityb) Courage and sacrifice, truth and peace, faith and chivalryc) Energy, growth, and unityd) Freedom, equality, and harmony10. Which act formally granted India its independence from British rule?a) The Government of India Act, 1935b) The Indian Councils Act, 1909c) The Indian Independence Act, 1947d) The Cabinet Mission PlanAnswers:1. c) 15 August2. b) Jawaharlal Nehru3. c) 19474. c) Red Fort5. a) Saffron, white, green, and navy blue6. c) Pingali Venkayya7. b) Jana Gana Mana8. b) Rabindranath Tagore9. b) Courage and sacrifice, truth and peace, faith and chivalry10. c) The Indian Independence Act, 1947TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. New York’s job engine sputters with just 956 new positions in the first six months of 2025: Is this a recession warning for young professionals?
New York's job market is showing signs of weakness, with a significant drop in private-sector job creation in the first half of 2025. Only 956 new jobs were added, a sharp contrast to the 66,000 created last year. This slowdown, attributed to rising costs, political tensions, and technological shifts like AI, is raising concerns about a potential recession.
New York’s job engine sputters with just 956 new positions in the first six months of 2025: Is this a recession warning for young professionals? - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsNew York’s job engine sputters with just 956 new positions in the first six months of 2025: Is this a recession warning for young professionals?TrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechUPSC CSE Main 2025 Admit CardMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultNew York’s job engine sputters with just 956 new positions in the first six months of 2025: Is this a recession warning for young professionals?Lakshima Sareen / TOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 18:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeNew York's job market is showing signs of weakness, with a significant drop in private-sector job creation in the first half of 2025. Only 956 new jobs were added, a sharp contrast to the 66,000 created last year. This slowdown, attributed to rising costs, political tensions, and technological shifts like AI, is raising concerns about a potential recession.  New York, once the lodestar of America’s labour market, is losing some of its shine. According to the city’s Mayor’s Office of Management and Budget, the first half of 2025 produced just 956 new private-sector jobs—the feeblest gain outside a recession or pandemic since 2003. The contrast with the 66,000 positions created in the same period last year is stark. Such anaemic growth is stirring fears that the slowdown is less a local hiccup than an early warning of a broader recession, with the city’s newest workers—graduates and young professionals—likely to bear the brunt.A job market under pressureThe numbers released by N.Y.C. Office of Management and Budget are striking. As per the report, the city added 66,000 jobs in the same period last year, highlighting the dramatic slowdown. Projections for the full year suggest roughly 31,900 new positions, far below pre-pandemic levels of around 100,000 annually. The report also highlights the unemployment rate in the city, which stands at 4.7% — higher than the state and national averages, with younger workers particularly affected.As reported by the New York Times, sectors like finance and insurance have seen losses, shedding thousands of jobs, while hospitality and retail continue to struggle. Mid-level positions—the backbone of NYC’s workforce—are shrinking, leaving graduates and early-career professionals with fewer opportunities.Stalled hiring: What’s the trigger?Economists point to multiple contributing factors. Rising costs from on-again, off-again tariffs have made companies hesitant to expand. Political tensions have reduced tourism, affecting restaurants, hotels, and retail businesses. At the same time, technological shifts, especially the adoption of AI in finance and professional services, are reshaping hiring practices and reducing demand for new employees. Some firms are even considering relocating offices to lower-cost states such as Florida and Texas.Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody’s Analytics, told the New York Times, "The New York City economy has gone sideways so far this year. New York is a leading indicator, and the flattening of employment is now showing up nationally."Implications for students and young professionalsFor those just starting their careers, the slowdown signals a need to rethink traditional approaches to job hunting. Adaptability is critical, and developing technical skills alongside strong soft skills like communication, problem-solving, and critical thinking has become more important than ever.Geographic flexibility and openness to remote work can help students access opportunities beyond traditional hubs. Leveraging career centers, city programs, and networking opportunities can make a tangible difference, especially when competition is high. Staying informed about broader economic trends can also guide strategic decisions about career paths and timing of entry into the workforce.Looking aheadNew York City’s hiring stall serves as a warning that no job market is immune to economic, political, and technological disruptions. Lauren Melodia, director of economic and fiscal policy at the New School, told the New York Times, "It is shocking because we aren't in a recession. At the same time, it's not shocking given the political environment and impact on the economy."For students and graduates, the key takeaway is clear: preparing for uncertainty, diversifying skills, and being proactive in career planning are no longer optional—they are essential for navigating today’s evolving job market.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousOne's own enemy: 8 animals that get triggered by their own reflectionLifestyleIndependence Day 2025: 10 Arjun Tendulkar studied in this school: Tracing his education, cricketing career and more
Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, is carving his own path. From his education at Dhirubhai Ambani International School to graduating from Mumbai University, he balanced academics with cricket. He debuted for India U-19 in 2018 and later joined Mumbai Indians in the IPL. A move to Goa provided more playing time, highlighted by a first-class century.
Arjun Tendulkar studied in this school: Tracing his education, cricketing career and more - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsArjun Tendulkar studied in this school: Tracing his education, cricketing career and moreTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultArjun Tendulkar studied in this school: Tracing his education, cricketing career and moreTOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 18:25 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeArjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, is carving his own path. From his education at Dhirubhai Ambani International School to graduating from Mumbai University, he balanced academics with cricket. He debuted for India U-19 in 2018 and later joined Mumbai Indians in the IPL. A move to Goa provided more playing time, highlighted by a first-class century. Arjun Tendulkar with father and cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar (Image: Instagram) In India, where cricket often feels like a second religion, a name like Tendulkar carries expectations that are hard to escape. Born on September 24, 1999, to Sachin Tendulkar, one of the game’s most celebrated figures, Arjun Tendulkar has grown up in the public eye. His journey so far has been a mix of steady steps in education, a developing cricket career, and most recently, a new chapter in his personal life—his engagement to Saaniya Chandok, granddaughter of Mumbai businessman Ravi Ghai.Schooling and academic base Arjun began his education at the Dhirubhai Ambani International School in Mumbai, an institution known for its rigorous academics and well-rounded approach to student development. There, he built the foundations of his education while also pursuing cricket. Balancing both academics and sport, he went on to complete his graduation from Mumbai University, signalling that studies remained part of his plan even as cricket took centre stage.Early steps in cricketArjun’s cricketing journey started in Mumbai’s junior teams, where he began to pick up match experience and develop his skills. The first significant milestone came in 2018, when he made his under-19 debut for India against Sri Lanka. On January 15, 2021, he played his first T20 match for Mumbai in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy against Haryana, taking one wicket for 34 runs in his three overs.IPL entry and challengesAhead of the 2021 Indian Premier League season, Mumbai Indians brought Arjun into their squad at the player auction. He was first picked in Mumbai’s senior Syed Mushtaq Ali squad on January 2, 2021. In late September 2021, he was ruled out of the 2021 IPL due to injury, delaying his chance to make an impact. The Mumbai Indians signed him again in February 2022, reflecting continued interest in his potential, even if opportunities remained limited.A move to Goa and first-class cricketIn August 2022, Arjun took the decision to leave Mumbai cricket and join Goa for the domestic season, a shift aimed at securing more playing time and responsibility. Representing Goa in the 2022–23 Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy and Ranji Trophy, he made his first-class debut on December 13, 2022, against Rajasthan. Batting in the first innings, he scored 120 runs off 207 balls—his maiden century in first-class cricket. The innings was a highlight in his career so far and offered a glimpse of his potential in longer formats.IPL debut and first wicketOn April 16, 2023, Arjun made his IPL debut for Mumbai Indians against Kolkata Knight Riders. Shortly afterwards, in a match against Sunrisers Hyderabad, he claimed his first IPL wicket by dismissing Bhuvneshwar Kumar. These moments, though modest in the larger scheme of the tournament, marked personal milestones in his progression as a player.A career still in progressArjun Tendulkar’s cricketing record so far may not yet match the weight of his surname, but his journey reflects a willingness to take calculated steps—shifting teams, adjusting focus, and balancing education with sport. Off the field, his recent engagement marks a new phase in his personal life. On the field, his career remains a work in progress, with each season offering another opportunity to define himself on his own terms.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. Get expert guidance now!End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousOne's own enemy: 8 animals that get triggered by their own reflectionLifestyleIndependence Day 2025: 10 UPSC CSE main 2025 admit card out at upsc.gov.in; download here for the August 22 exam
The UPSC has released the admit card for the CSE Main 2025 exam scheduled for August 22. Candidates can download their hall tickets from upsc.gov.in using their registration ID and date of birth. It is mandatory to carry the printed admit card and a valid photo ID on exam day. Candidates should verify details carefully and report discrepancies promptly. Multiple copies are advised, and Covid-19 protocols may apply at the exam centres.

Candidates can download their hall tickets from upsc.gov.in using their registration ID and date of birth. It is mandatory to carry the printed admit card and a valid photo ID on exam day. Candidates should verify details carefully and report discrepancies promptly. Multiple copies are advised, and Covid-19 protocols may apply at the exam centres. UPSC CSE main 2025 admit card out at upsc.gov.in for August 22 exam UPSC CSE main 2025 admit card: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has released the admit card for the UPSC Civil Services Examination (CSE) Main 2025. Candidates registered for the examination can now download their hall tickets from the official website, upsc.gov.in. The exam is scheduled to be held on August 22, and candidates must carry the admit card along with a valid photo ID to gain entry to the exam centre.The UPSC CSE Main 2025 admit card will remain available for download until August 31. However, candidates are advised to obtain their admit cards well before the exam date to avoid any last-minute difficulties. It is important to verify all details on the admit card to ensure accuracy and to report any discrepancies to the UPSC helpline promptly.Essential documents and instructions for the exam dayCandidates appearing for the UPSC CSE Main 2025 must carry a printed copy of their admit card as well as an original photo identification card. Accepted forms of photo ID include Aadhaar, PAN, Passport, or Voter ID. Both documents must match exactly, as discrepancies can result in denial of entry to the examination hall.The commission prohibits mobile phones, smartwatches, and other electronic gadgets inside the exam venue. Candidates are also advised against carrying bags or valuables, as there will be no storage facilities at the exam centre. It is vital to follow all instructions printed on the admit card, including the reporting time and permitted stationery, to avoid disqualification.Steps to download the UPSC CSE main 2025 admit card at upsc.gov.inStep 1: Visit the official UPSC website at upsc.gov.in.Step 2: Navigate to the 'Admit Card' or 'Download Hall Ticket' section on the homepage.Step 3: Enter your registration ID or roll number along with your date of birth in the specified format.Step 4: Submit the details to access your admit card.Step 5: Download and print at least two copies of the admit card – one for the exam day and a backup copy.Direct link to download the UPSC CSE main 2025 admit cardVerifying details and resolving discrepanciesCandidates should carefully check all personal information on their admit card, including name, photograph, and exam centre address. Any errors must be reported immediately to the UPSC helpdesk via email at helpdesk@upsc.gov.in or by calling the official helpline numbers. Early reporting helps ensure corrections are made before the exam day, preventing complications at the centre.Exam structure and eligibility rulesThe UPSC CSE Main consists of nine written papers followed by a personality test. Seven papers count towards the final merit list, while two language papers are qualifying in nature. Candidates must write the language papers in the script corresponding to their chosen language.Eligibility to appear for the mains is limited to candidates who have qualified in the Preliminary exam. Candidates previously appointed to the IAS or IFS are not eligible to appear again, while IPS appointees may reappear but cannot opt for the IPS cadre again. Carrying a valid degree certificate or provisional mark sheet along with the admit card is mandatory.Exam day tips and covid-19 protocolsCandidates are advised to plan their route to the exam centre well in advance and arrive early to avoid last-minute stress. Printing multiple copies of the admit card and safely storing them is recommended. Depending on the prevailing health guidelines, candidates may need to follow Covid-19 safety measures, including wearing masks and carrying hand sanitiser, as specified on the admit card.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now.
