Haryana ADA apply online 2025 begins for 255 posts at hpsc.gov.in, check eligibility and deadline
HPSC ADA recruitment 2025: The Haryana Public Service Commission (HPSC) has begun the online application process for 255 Assistant District Attorney (ADA) posts in the Prosecution Department. The application window opened on August 13, 2025, and will close on September 2, 2025, at 5:00 PM. Eligible candidates with a Law degree and Bar Council enrolment can apply via hpsc.gov.in. The recruitment includes category-wise reservations, an application fee, and a multi-stage selection process.
Haryana ADA apply online 2025 begins for 255 posts at hpsc.gov.in, check eligibility and deadline - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIEducationNewsHPBOSE Class 10th ResultHPBOSE Class 12th ResultExamsResultsJobsBoardsCareersBrain TeaserMedicineNEET UG ExamScholar SpotlightWeb StoriesCollegesStudy AbroadLearning with TOIBSEB Class 12 ResultBSEB Class 10 ResultMP Board 12th ResultMP Board 10th ResultUP Board 10th ResultUP Board 12th ResultRBSE Class 12 ResultRBSE Class 10 ResultWBBSE Class 10th ResultWBCHSE Class 12th ResultAP Board Class 10th ResultToday's ePaperNewsEducation NewsNewsHaryana ADA apply online 2025 begins for 255 posts at hpsc.gov.in, check eligibility and deadlineTrendingIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultIndependence Day 2025 SpeechFMGE ResultMPSC Admit CardMaharashtra NEET UG CounsellingHaryana NEET 2025 CounsellingUP Neet UG CounsellingBSF Head Constable RecruitmentMP Board ExamSSC Exam 2025SBI PO Prelims ResultHaryana ADA apply online 2025 begins for 255 posts at hpsc.gov.in, check eligibility and deadlineSanjay Sharma / TOI Education /  Aug 14, 2025, 17:37 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHPSC ADA recruitment 2025: The Haryana Public Service Commission (HPSC) has begun the online application process for 255 Assistant District Attorney (ADA) posts in the Prosecution Department. The application window opened on August 13, 2025, and will close on September 2, 2025, at 5:00 PM. Eligible candidates with a Law degree and Bar Council enrolment can apply via hpsc.gov.in. The recruitment includes category-wise reservations, an application fee, and a multi-stage selection process. Haryana ADA apply online 2025 begins at HPSC for 255 posts, check eligibility and how to apply HPSC ADA recruitment 2025: The Haryana Public Service Commission (HPSC) has officially commenced the online application process for the recruitment of Assistant District Attorney (ADA) posts in the Prosecution Department of Haryana. A total of 255 vacancies have been announced under Advertisement No. 18/2025.As per the official notification released on August 8, 2025, the application window opened on August 13, 2025, and will remain active until September 2, 2025, up to 5:00 PM. Eligible candidates can apply through the official website of the commission at hpsc.gov.in.Application and vacancy details for Haryana ADA recruitment 2025The recruitment drive is for 255 ADA posts in the Prosecution Department of Haryana. Candidates must possess a Bachelor’s degree in Law (LLB) from a recognised university and be enrolled as an Advocate with the Bar Council. Additionally, proficiency in Hindi or Sanskrit up to the Matriculation level is mandatory.Below is the category-wise distribution of vacancies:CategoryNo. of VacanciesGeneral (UR)134Other Scheduled Castes (OSC)26Denotified/Scheduled Castes (DSC)26Backward Class A (BCA)28Backward Class B (BCB)15Economically Weaker Section (EWS)26Total255Eligibility criteria for Haryana ADA 2025 recruitmentTo be eligible for the ADA post, a candidate must:• Hold a Bachelor’s degree in Law (LLB) from a recognised university• Be enrolled as an Advocate with the Bar Council• Have studied Hindi or Sanskrit up to the Matriculation level• Be aged between 21 and 42 years as of September 2, 2025 (age relaxation applies as per Haryana government rules)Direct link to apply online for Haryana ADA recruitment 2025Haryana ADA application fee detailsCandidates must pay the application fee online using Net Banking, Debit Card, or Credit Card before 5:00 PM on September 2, 2025. The fee is non-refundable and varies by category:CategoryApplication Fee (INR)General / Other State1000SC / BC-A / BC-B / EWS / ESM / Women250PwBD (Persons with Benchmark Disability)NilDocuments required for Haryana ADA applicationApplicants must upload scanned copies of the following documents:• LLB degree certificate• Bar Council enrolment certificate• Recent passport-size photograph and signature• Valid identity proof (Aadhaar, passport, etc.)• Caste/category certificate (if applicable)• Any other documents specified in the official notificationHow to apply online for Haryana ADA recruitment 2025Candidates can follow the steps below to apply:Step 1: Visit the official HPSC website: hpsc.gov.inStep 2: Register using Aadhaar number or mobile credentials (ensure Aadhaar data is updated)Step 3: Log in to access the “Apply Online” section and locate Advertisement No. 18/2025Step 4: Fill in personal, educational, and professional details accurately, including Bar Council informationStep 5: Upload required documents, pay the application fee, and submit the form. Download and print the confirmation page for recordsSelection process for Haryana ADA 2025 recruitmentThe selection process may consist of the following stages:• Screening test (if required)• Subject knowledge test• Interview / Viva-voce• Document verificationOfficial website for applicationThe application process must be completed online via the official portal at hpsc.gov.in. The last date to apply is September 2, 2025, up to 5:00 PM.TOI Education is on WhatsApp now. Follow us here.Ready to navigate global policies? Secure your overseas future. 'Coolie' box office collections day 2 (Live)
Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' is off to a roaring start, grossing Rs 76.78 crore net in India after two days. The film, directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, opened strongly with Rs 65 crore on day one, with Tamil leading the way. Occupancy rates remain high across Tamil, Telugu, and Hindi versions, fueled by a star-studded cast and positive audience reception.
'Coolie' box office collections day 2 (Live): Rajinikanth starrer crosses Rs 76.78 cr; Tamil occupancy holds strong at 63.86% | Tamil Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardsNewsentertainmenttamilmoviesbox-office'Coolie' box office collections day 2 (Live): Rajinikanth starrer crosses Rs 76.78 cr; Tamil occupancy holds strong at 63.86%TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office Collection'Coolie' box office collections day 2 (Live): Rajinikanth starrer crosses Rs 76.78 cr; Tamil occupancy holds strong at 63.86%Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 14:05 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRajinikanth's 'Coolie' is off to a roaring start, grossing Rs 76.78 crore net in India after two days. The film, directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, opened strongly with Rs 65 crore on day one, with Tamil leading the way. Occupancy rates remain high across Tamil, Telugu, and Hindi versions, fueled by a star-studded cast and positive audience reception. (Picture Courtesy: Facebook) Rajinikanth’s latest blockbuster, 'Coolie', continues to draw massive crowds, starting its second day with a total India net of Rs 76.78 crore.The film, which opened on Thursday to thunderous response, earned an estimated Rs 65 crore net on Day 1 across languages.As reported by the Sacnilk website, Tamil is leading at Rs 45 crore, followed by Telugu at Rs 15 crore, Hindi at Rs 4.5 crore, and Kannada at Rs 50 lakhs.On Day 2 (Friday, August 15, 2025), Coolie added Rs 11.78 crore to its tally.Coolie | Song - I Am The Danger (Lyrical)PollWill 'Coolie' surpass the Rs 100 crore mark by the end of the extended weekend?YesNoTamil leads the charge with over 63% occupancyThe film’s Tamil version continues to dominate the charts. It has recorded an overall 63.86% occupancy in theaters on Friday as per early eastimates. Morning shows alone saw packed crowds. This is particularly in Chennai, Madurai, and Coimbatore.The Hindi version, titled 'Coolie: The Powerhouse', clocked an overall 30.23% occupancy. The metropolitan areas like Mumbai and Delhi are performing better than expected.Telugu audiences also turned up in large numbers. The area has a robust 68.14% occupancy on Day 2. Andhra Pradesh and Telangana turned out to be key contributors to the film’s pan-India success.Star-studded cast fuels pan-India pullThe film is directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj. 'Coolie boasts a powerhouse ensemble featuring Rajinikanth, Nagarjuna Akkineni, Shruthi Haasan, Upendra, Sathyaraj, Soubin Shahir, and Aamir Khan. Independence Day weekend will be crucial in determining the film’s long-term box office run. Sunday advance bookings are looking strong. 'Coolie' is expected to cross the Rs 100 crore mark in India net collections within its first extended weekend.DISCLAIMER: The box office numbers in this article are compiled from our proprietarysources and diverse public data. While we strive for accuracy, all figures areapproximate unless explicitly mentioned, offering a fair representation of the project'sbox office performance. We are open to feedback and suggestions ontoientertainment@timesinternet.in."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the कलाकारांच्या मुलाखती, ट्रेलर विश्लेषण, गॉसिप्स आणि सोशल मीडिया ट्रेंड्सवरील विश्वासार्ह आणि मनोरंजक माहिती आम्ही सर्जनशील शैलीत वाचकांपर्यंत पोहोचवितो. माहिती आणि मनोरंजन यांचा समतोल राखणे हे आमचे Did Jr NTR's fan light FLAMETHROWER inside theatre? - WATCH
During the 'War 2' premiere, a fan of Jr NTR ignited what appeared to be a flamethrower inside a theater, sparking safety concerns. This incident, during Jr NTR's entry scene, prompted mixed reactions online, with some criticizing the dangerous behavior. Similar incidents occurred previously, such as during a 'Tiger 3' screening, raising alarms about safety enforcement in cinemas.
'War 2': Did Jr NTR's fan light up a FLAMETHROWER inside theatre? Video of fan-frenzy goes viral- WATCH | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimesTOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsNews'War 2': Did Jr NTR's fan light up a FLAMETHROWER inside theatre? Video of fan-frenzy goes viral- WATCH'War 2': Did Jr NTR's fan light up a FLAMETHROWER inside theatre? Video of fan-frenzy goes viral- WATCHTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 15, 2025, 13:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeDuring the 'War 2' premiere, a fan of Jr NTR ignited what appeared to be a flamethrower inside a theater, sparking safety concerns. This incident, during Jr NTR's entry scene, prompted mixed reactions online, with some criticizing the dangerous behavior. Similar incidents occurred previously, such as during a 'Tiger 3' screening, raising alarms about safety enforcement in cinemas.  The release of 'War 2' sparked massive celebrations and fanfare among fans of actor Jr NTR, who plays a leading role in the Bollywood film. But while most of the celebrations involved fans throwing confetti showers in the theatres, coupled with cheering, dancing and cheering, one viral incident has raised serious safety concerns.The incident in question features a man lighting up a 'flame thrower' inside the theatre. The frenzy began with Jr NTR’s much-hyped entry scene where the superstar ‘flies’ onto the screen via a drone, landing shirtless on a ship and flaunting his chiselled eight-pack abs. As the crowd erupts, he is introduced on-screen as the “Man of the Masses.” While others in the audience threw confetti, applauded and whistled, one group of fans rushed to the front of the theatre and raised eyebrows with their unruly behaviour. Viral VideoIn the footage, a group of enthusiastic fans is seen dancing near the screen with posters, when one man appears to ignite what looks like a flamethrower. It remains unclear whether he used a lighter and deodorant spray to create the flame effect or if he actually brought a flamethrower to the theatre, but the stunt has raised alarm over the potential risk to fellow moviegoers.Safety ConcernsSocial media reactions have been mixed. While some brushed it off as part of the celebration, many netizens slammed the behaviour, pointing out the fire dangers. “This could have gone horribly wrong,” one user commented.Similar Past ReactionsThis is not the first time that Bollywood films have seen such celebrations turn hazardous. In 2023, Salman Khan fans made headlines for lighting fireworks inside a theatre during 'Tiger 3' screening at Mohan Cinema in Malegaon, Maharashtra. The incident, which included rockets and string bombs ignited in the front rows, caused panic among audiences and led to calls for stricter safety enforcement in cinemas. The viral video even prompted Salman to put out a tweet warning fans about the dangers of such actions.Box Office Performance'War 2' recorded a massive Rs 52.50 crore debut at the box office, and according to early estiamtes on Day 2, the film has added another Rs 8.33 crore to its kitty. This takes the Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR and Kiara Advani starrer’s total earnings to Rs 60.83 crore in just two days.The film, which is part of YRF’s lucrative Spy Universe, has been drawing audiences with its high-octane action sequences and the first-time pairing of Hrithik and Jr NTR. While the Hindi version’s opening fell short of expectations, the Telugu dubbed version has emerged as a key contributor, powered by Jr NTR’s massive fan following in the South.With the Independence Day holiday driving higher footfalls across the country, trade analysts predict a strong upward trajectory for the weekend, with the potential to cross the Rs 100 crore mark. However, competition from Rajinikanth’s 'Coolie' in southern markets remains a factor to watch in the days ahead."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousThe Life of a Showgirl: A look back at Taylor Swift's blockbuster hits ahead of new releaseEntertainment10 Shri Krishna quotes from the Bhagavad Gita that are great relationship tipsLifestyleCreative makeup ideas to try for Independence Day celebrationLifestyleDivine baby names inspired by Lord KrishnaastrologyAshnoor Kaur’s top 10 ultra-glam lookstvRubina Dilaik's powerful reality show lookstvIn pic: Radiant pictures of Pooja HegdeEntertainment5 human body parts we may no longer need in the futureLifestyleBollywood-approved ethnic sets that are perfect for Independence Day 2025Lifestyle10 Stunning ethnic looks of Megha Shettytv Next123 Photostories  12 years, 12 safas: PM Narendra Modi’s safas that made every Independence Day unforgettableIndependence Day 2025: From Red Fort pride to nation’s colourful celebrations ( see pics)Independence Day 2025: 5 lesser known women nationalistsIndependence Day: PM Modi's iconic turban looks at Red Fort since 2014 - In picsBeyond the Crown: Lara Dutta’s surprising life stories9 health benefits of potatoes (backed by science)Janmashtami 2025: 5 diabetes-friendly sweet recipes for Janmashtami bhog50 Years of Thalaivar: Rajinikanth’s iconic movies that fans cherish forever7 workout supplements every fitness enthusiast should know5 simple chia seed recipes that help in weight loss123Top TrendingLeBron JamesTom BradyDwyane WadeBrock Lesnar Net WorthPlayStation Plus GamesShedeur SanderStefon DiggsJoy TaylorNYU StudentsPatrick MahmoesTired of too many ads?go ad free nowTrending StoriesIn SectionEntire WebsiteIndependence Day 2025 Live Updates: PM Modi calls for indigenous jet engines; 'War 2' crosses Rs 50 crore mark; catches up to 'Coolie'
Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' has exceeded expectations, earning Rs 52.50 crore on its opening day. Boosted by a strong Telugu dubbed version, which amassed Rs 23.25 crore, the film surpassed initial modest predictions. While the Hindi version contributed Rs 29 crore, it was the regional performance that propelled 'War 2' past the Rs 50 crore mark.
War 2 Full Movie Collection: 'War 2' box office collection Day 1: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR and Kiara Advani starrer crosses Rs 50 crore mark; catches up to Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsbox officemovie reviewsmovie listingsanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamilteluguNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodbox-office'War 2' box office collection Day 1: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR and Kiara Advani starrer crosses Rs 50 crore mark; catches up to Rajinikanth's 'Coolie'TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office Collection'War 2' box office collection Day 1: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR and Kiara Advani starrer crosses Rs 50 crore mark; catches up to Rajinikanth's 'Coolie'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 12:40 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' has exceeded expectations, earning Rs 52.50 crore on its opening day. Boosted by a strong Telugu dubbed version, which amassed Rs 23.25 crore, the film surpassed initial modest predictions. While the Hindi version contributed Rs 29 crore, it was the regional performance that propelled 'War 2' past the Rs 50 crore mark.  Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR’s spy-action thriller 'War 2' has surpassed expectations at the domestic box office, delivering an opening day collection of Rs 52.50 crore (early estimates) and catching up to Rajinikanth’s 'Coolie' in the race for top spot.War 2 Movie ReviewAdvance BookingsBefore release, advance booking trends suggested a modest start, with trade analysts predicting the film could record the lowest opening in YRF’s Spy Universe. Many expected it to debut around Rs 43 crore net, similar to Salman Khan’s 'Tiger 3', despite its large-scale production and star power.Hrithik Roshan calls Jr. NTR 'incredible' and his favorite co‑star for 'War 2'Hindi Box Office CollectionsHowever, the film surprised at the ticket counters, with the Hindi version contributing an estimated Rs 29 crore net on Day 1. While this figure is a marked improvement over advance ticket sales, it still falls short of several franchise entries, including 'Ek Tha Tiger' which earned an estimated Rs 32.93 crore way back in 2012. This makes it the lowest Hindi opener in YRF’s Spy Universe, while Shah Rukh Khan's 'Pathaan' occupies the top spot with a collection of Rs 55 crore.PollWhich version of 'War 2' do you think performed best at the box office?Hindi VersionTelugu Dubbed VersionTamil and Telugu CollectionsSignificantly, it was the Telugu dubbed version that boosted overall earnings, amassing an impressive Rs 23.25 crore net, driven largely by Jr NTR’s massive fan base. The Tamil version added a modest Rs 25 lakh. This strong regional performance helped War 2 comfortably cross the Rs 50 crore mark on opening day.Occupancy figures reflected this divide, Hindi shows recorded 29.24% occupancy on Thursday, while Tamil shows achieved a stronger 42.41%.War 2 Misses War recordWar 2 may have opened big, but it narrowly missed matching the benchmark set by its predecessor, 'War' (2019), which had stormed the box office with a record-breaking Rs 53 crore opening day. Despite boasting a bigger budget, scale, a multi-language release, and the added star power of Jr NTR alongside Hrithik , the sequel’s debut collection fell just short of surpassing the original's milestone. Interestingly, while the original netted a higher Hindi collection, this one relied heavily on the Telugu collections to hit the mark.Jr NTS' FandomFans of the latter actor have been praising his performance in the movie. Vijayawada NTR Fans District Association president Kavuri Krishna states that the movie 'War 2' has been released in theatres, and they hope NTR's action will secure great viewership across the world. Talking to ANI he expressed happiness over NTR's performance in this bilingual film and predicted that the movie would create records at the box office. Krishna said that NTR played a vital role in the film, portraying a character who protects India, and praised Director Mukerji for presenting NTR so well. "Hats off to Mukerji," he added.Baji, an NTR fan, said that NTR's character in the movie was "awesome," and thanked Director Mukerji for choosing Jr NTR for the role. He praised the actor's dance and fight sequences, saying, "The period before 'War 2' and after 'War 2' should be calculated separately for his career."Sunil, another NTR fan, said 'War 2' was an excellent film and that NTR has now dominated Bollywood with his performance.Early PredictionsIndustry estimates suggest the film’s total India gross for Day 1 could exceed Rs 60 crore once all language versions are included, with early gross estimates already touching Rs 65 crore.On the whole, the two films have amassed an estimated combined total of Rs 117.50 crore. Coolie Box Office CollectionsDespite its success, competition from 'Coolie' in the southern markets and mixed audience reception, praising action but critiquing pacing, may affect momentum. With the Independence Day holiday and weekend ahead, 'War 2' still has the potential to build on its strong start and improve its Hindi market performance.DISCLAIMER: The box office numbers in this article are compiled from our proprietary sources and diverse public data. While we strive for accuracy, all figures are approximate unless explicitly mentioned, offering a fair representation of the project's box office performance. We are open to feedback and suggestions on toientertainment@timesinternet.in. 'Coolie' scores huge opening day collection of Rs 65 crore
Rajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, released on August 14. The film clashed with 'War 2' but dominated the box office. 'Coolie' earned approximately Rs 65 crore in India on its opening day. Overseas collections are estimated at Rs 75 crore. The film's worldwide collection reached around Rs 140 crore.
Coolie Full Movie Collection: 'Coolie' box office collection day 1: Rajinikanth's action drama scores HUGE opening day collection of Rs 65 crore | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardsNewsentertainmenttamilmoviesbox-office'Coolie' box office collection day 1: Rajinikanth's action drama scores HUGE opening day collection of Rs 65 croreTrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office Collection'Coolie' box office collection day 1: Rajinikanth's action drama scores HUGE opening day collection of Rs 65 croreTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 09:34 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRajinikanth's 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, released on August 14. The film clashed with 'War 2' but dominated the box office. 'Coolie' earned approximately Rs 65 crore in India on its opening day. Overseas collections are estimated at Rs 75 crore. The film's worldwide collection reached around Rs 140 crore. Picture Credit: X Superstar Rajinikanth's latest gangster action drama 'Coolie', directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, was released in theatres on August 14, just a day before Independence Day, and created a storm at the box office. Released with massive hype, the film went head-to-head with the Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR starrer War 2, coming out victorious on Day 1 of this box office battle.Coolie Movie Review‘Coolie’ release sparks madness: Rajinikanth fans dance and flood theatres in Tamil NaduCoolie dominates domestic box officeAccording to early estimates from trade analyst Sacnilk, Coolie has registered one of the biggest openings ever for a Tamil film. In Tamil Nadu, the movie ruled the roost with an estimated Rs 28–30 crore gross, which is one of the state's highest-ever day-one figures. Beyond its home base, the film is also pulling in Rs 16–18 crore gross in Andhra Pradesh/Telangana, Rs 14–15 crore gross in Karnataka, and approximately Rs 10 crore gross in Kerala.Interestingly, 'Coolie' also made a strong impact in the Hindi-speaking belt. Outside the South, the Rest of India's day-one collection is estimated at Rs 7–8 crore gross. Overall, the film amassed a staggering Rs 65 crore on its opening day in India. Overseas, the Rajinikanth starrer is estimated to have collected around Rs 75 crore, pushing its worldwide collection to around Rs 140 crore.PollDid you watch Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' on its opening day?YesNoTheatre OccupancyIn Tamil Nadu, Coolie enjoyed an overall 86.99% occupancy on Thursday, with morning shows at 81.95%, afternoons at 85.13%, evenings at 86.57%, and night shows peaking at an impressive 94.32%. In the Hindi belt, Coolie: The Powerhouse clocked an overall 35.66% occupancy, starting at 25.34% in the morning, climbing through the afternoon (31.50%) and evening (30.63%), before hitting 55.18% at night.Telugu markets went all out for Rajinikanth, with the film recording an extraordinary 92.10% occupancy overall, morning shows at 91.25%, afternoon at 93.01%, evening at 89.01%, and night shows touching 95.12%. Karnataka was another stronghold, with Coolie pulling a 71.37% average occupancy, from 58.46% in the morning to 87.20% by night.'Coolie' is expected to sustain this momentum through the weekend with the Independence Day holiday boost and overwhelmingly positive audience feedback.The film centers around Devaraj "Deva," a former coolie union leader who investigates the mysterious death of his friend Rajasekhar. 'Coolie' stars Rajinikanth alongside Nagarjuna, Shruti Haasan, Upendra, Soubin Shahir, Sathyaraj, and Aamir Khan in a brief role.DISCLAIMER: The box office numbers in this article are compiled from our proprietary sources and diverse public data. While we strive for accuracy, all figures are approximate unless explicitly mentioned, offering a fair representation of the project's box office performance. We are open to feedback and suggestions on toientertainment@timesinternet.in. When SRK spoke about the pain of having his patriotism questioned
Shah Rukh Khan, a Bollywood icon, once expressed his deep sorrow over having his patriotism questioned, even admitting it brought him to tears. He passionately declared himself a proud Indian, urging the youth to prioritize unity and progress over division.
When Shah Rukh Khan spoke about the pain of having his patriotism questioned; said he felt like crying; declared he’s the “Proudest Indian in the world” | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodWhen Shah Rukh Khan spoke about the pain of having his patriotism questioned; said he felt like crying; declared he’s the “Proudest Indian in the world”TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionWhen Shah Rukh Khan spoke about the pain of having his patriotism questioned; said he felt like crying; declared he’s the “Proudest Indian in the world”TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 15, 2025, 13:23 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShah Rukh Khan, a Bollywood icon, once expressed his deep sorrow over having his patriotism questioned, even admitting it brought him to tears. He passionately declared himself a proud Indian, urging the youth to prioritize unity and progress over division.  In a candid and emotional interview, Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan once spoke out about the pain of having his patriotism questioned, admitting he felt like crying over the need to defend his love for India. The 'Jawan' star, who has faced intense public scrutiny, declared himself the "proudest Indian in the world," urging the nation to rise above division and focus on progress. His powerful message resonated with many, highlighting the difference between genuine contribution and public performance.Let's take a closer look at this throwback moment.Shah Rukh Khan on the pain of having his patriotism questionedShah Rukh Khan, one of India’s most iconic stars, once opened up about the emotional toll of having his love for the country questioned. In an interview on Aap Ki Adalat, the Jawan star admitted, “Sometimes I feel very sad, I even feel like crying, that I should be made to say that I belong to this country, I am a patriot.” These remarks came during a period of intense public scrutiny, and his quiet dignity in the face of such adversity highlighted his firm belief that patriotism shouldn't be a competition.SRK on urging the youth to rise above divisionIn that heartfelt interview, SRK also directed a powerful message to the younger generation. He expressed his sadness at having to constantly explain his love for India and urged young people to focus on unity and progress. He called India "the greatest country in the world," highlighting its safety, beauty, and unity. For him, true patriotism lies in working hard and contributing to the nation's future, not in getting trapped in "small, petty matters" that divide the country. SRK said, “I get very sad when I have to explain each time how good a patriot I am,” he said. “I will tell all young people to be tolerant, be happy, work hard, and take this nation forward.” SRK on declaring his unshakable pride in IndiaThe superstar made it clear that no amount of public debate could shake his love for the country that made him who he is. "Whether my film is a hit or not, I want to say for the last time, there is no patriot greater than me in this country," he asserted. He added that no one has received more love from India than he has, and that he and his family will always work for its greatness, a sentiment that resonated deeply with his millions of fans.Work frontA few days ago, the 71st National Film Awards were announced, and Shah Rukh Khan bagged the Best Actor honour for 'Jawan'. Now, the superstar is gearing up for his next big venture, 'King'. Directed by Siddharth Anand, this high-octane action thriller will bring SRK and his daughter Suhana Khan together on screen for the very first time. The film also features an impressive ensemble cast, including Abhishek Bachchan and Deepika Padukone, among others.Lilliput slams Shah Rukh Khan’s role in 'Zero', Says ‘Not even equal to Kamal Haasan’s dust'"Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousThe Life of a Showgirl: A look back at Anil celebrates Rhea and Karan wedding anniversary
Anil Kapoor celebrated his daughter Rhea Kapoor and Karan Boolani’s fourth wedding anniversary with a heartfelt social media post. He also wished his son-in-law Anand Ahuja a happy birthday, sharing family photos. Anil will star in Subedaar and upcoming YRF Spy Universe films like 'Alpha'.

He also wished his son-in-law Anand Ahuja a happy birthday, sharing family photos. Anil will star in Subedaar and upcoming YRF Spy Universe films like 'Alpha'. Anil Kapoor celebrated his daughter Rhea Kapoor and Karan Boolani’s fourth wedding anniversary with a heartfelt social media post. He also wished his son-in-law Anand Ahuja a happy birthday, sharing family photos. Anil will star in Subedaar and upcoming YRF Spy Universe films like 'Alpha'. Anil Kapoor shared a touching message on social media to celebrate the fourth wedding anniversary of his daughter, producer Rhea Kapoor, and filmmaker Karan Boolani. He posted a collection of rare photos showcasing the couple’s cherished moments, highlighting the love and close-knit family connections they share.Instagram tribute to the coupleTaking to Instagram, Anil shared a few adorable photos and wrote, “Happy Anniversary, @rheakapoor & @karanboolani ! Four years have flown by in a blur of laughter, love, family time, and the two of you always giving your best to your friends and teammates. Together, you are a rare strength in today’s world, a bond we deeply admire. Here’s to you both, and the beautiful life you’ve built, a source of pride and joy for our entire family!".Anand Ahuja’s birthday wishes from Anil KapoorAnand Ahuja, Sonam Kapoor’s husband, celebrated his birthday on July 29. He received many warm wishes from fans, friends, and family. One special message came from his father-in-law, Anil Kapoor, who shared heartfelt photos of the family on social media. Anil called Anand a “hands-on dad” and the “heart of their family.” The pictures showed Anil and Anand dressed alike, happy moments of Sonam and Anand, and Anand with their son, Vayu. The post ended with family photos that fans loved. The caption read, “Happy Birthday, Anand! From being the coolest sneakerhead to the most hands-on dad, you somehow manage it all without missing a beat (or dropping the ball)! You’re not just Sonam’s better half but truly the heart of our family. The love, calm, and chaos you bring is something we all cherish. Here’s to more hugs, dad drives, walks, and all the adventures you have with Vayu, your business wins, and family brunches! We love you and are lucky to call you ours, @anandahuja".Anil Kapoor’s upcoming projectsOn the work front, Anil Kapoor will star in ‘Subedaar’, an action drama directed by Suresh Triveni. The film is produced by Kapoor’s company AKFCN and Opening Image Films. Anil plays the main character, Subedaar Arjun Maurya, and Radhikka Madan is the lead actress. The movie is set in India’s heartland and will be available on Amazon Prime Video. After that, he will also be in the YRF Spy Universe movies like ‘Alpha’."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. Hrithik's net worth
Hrithik Roshan, despite being a star kid, has amassed a fortune of Rs. 3100 crore through strategic ventures beyond acting. His sportswear brand, HRX, valued at Rs 7,300 crore, is a major contributor. Roshan also earns significantly from film roles, endorsements, and real estate investments, including a sea-facing Juhu home and a Lonavala farmhouse.
Hrithik Roshan's net worth: From sea-facing Rs. 100 crore Juhu home to amassing Rs 3100 crore fortune that make him the richest star kid | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodHrithik Roshan's net worth: From sea-facing Rs. 100 crore Juhu home to amassing Rs 3100 crore fortune that make him the richest star kidTrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionHrithik Roshan's net worth: From sea-facing Rs. 100 crore Juhu home to amassing Rs 3100 crore fortune that make him the richest star kidTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 12:20 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHrithik Roshan, despite being a star kid, has amassed a fortune of Rs. 3100 crore through strategic ventures beyond acting. His sportswear brand, HRX, valued at Rs 7,300 crore, is a major contributor. Roshan also earns significantly from film roles, endorsements, and real estate investments, including a sea-facing Juhu home and a Lonavala farmhouse.  In Bollywood, being a star kid doesn’t automatically guarantee immense wealth, and Hrithik Roshan’s journey proves that sustained success takes more than just blockbuster roles. The 50-year-old actor, who first wowed audiences with 'Kaho Naa… Pyaar Hai', has built a fortune that now reportedly stands at a staggering Rs. 3100 crore, making him the richest star kid in the industry. This immense fortune is not solely from his acting career, but largely driven by his successful sportswear brand, HRX, and a series of strategic investments.Here's a closer look at the 'War 2' star's net worth.Hrithik Roshan flaunts sculpted physique in unfiltered 'War 2' prep workout clipHrithik Roshan's fortuneAs reported by GQ India, The biggest contributor to Roshan's wealth is his sportswear and lifestyle brand, HRX. Launched in 2013, the brand has become a massive success, with a reported valuation of around Rs 7,300 crore. This venture has been a game-changer, establishing a new model for celebrity-led businesses in India by focusing on authenticity and a community-driven approach.Hrithik Roshan's blockbuster films and high-value endorsementsRoshan's acting career remains a crucial part of his income. He reportedly commands a hefty fee for his film roles, with reports stating he was paid Rs. 85 crore for his film 'Fighter' and is set to earn between Rs. 48 and Rs. 80 crore for 'War 2.' The actor is also expected to step behind the camera for 'Krrish 4', marking his directorial debut. Beyond the big screen, he has also leveraged his massive social media following of over 47 million on Instagram to secure lucrative endorsement deals with major companies, further amplifying his brand value.Hrithik Roshan's smart investments and luxurious assetsIn addition to his professional ventures, Hrithik's wealth is tied to smart real estate investments. He owns a sprawling sea-facing Juhu home valued at approximately Rs. 100 crore and a tranquil farmhouse in Lonavala, worth an estimated Rs. 33 crore. These tangible assets, combined with his successful entrepreneurial efforts, ensure a continuous flow of wealth and solidify his financial status.Hrithik’s acting career remains the cornerstone of his financial empire. Fresh off 'Fighter', for which he was reportedly paid Rs 85 crore, he’s set to reprise his role in 'War 2' opposite Jr NTR and Kiara Advani, charging between Rs 48 and Rs 80 crore. The actor is also expected to step behind the camera for 'Krrish 4', marking his directorial debut. Hrithik Roshan's latest releaseMeanwhile, his most awaited 'War 2' has hit the big screens and is courting decent reviews."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousDivine baby names inspired by Lord 'Param Sundari': Christian group offended over church scene
Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor's upcoming film 'Param Sundari' faces controversy as a Christian group, Watchdog Foundation, demands the removal of a romantic scene filmed in a church. The group claims the scene disrespects the sanctity of the religious place and offends the Catholic community. Read on to know more.
'Param Sundari': Christian group takes offense over flirty church scene in Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor starrer; demands removal | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood'Param Sundari': Christian group takes offense over flirty church scene in Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor starrer; demands removalTrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office Collection'Param Sundari': Christian group takes offense over flirty church scene in Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor starrer; demands removalTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 12:58 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor's upcoming film 'Param Sundari' faces controversy as a Christian group, Watchdog Foundation, demands the removal of a romantic scene filmed in a church. The group claims the scene disrespects the sanctity of the religious place and offends the Catholic community. Read on to know more.  Sidharth Malhotra and Janhvi Kapoor's 'Param Sundari' has generated quite a buzz with its soothing soundtrack and mesmerizing sequences after the makers dropped the first trailer and songs. While everyone thought the film would be out in theaters without any issues, it seems that is not possible now. A Christian group has demanded the removal of a scene from the film, as it would hurt the Catholic sentiments.Here's what happened.'Param Sundari' in trouble over flirty church scene; Christian group demands removalAccording to a Mid-Day report, a Christian group named Watchdog Foundation has slammed the makers of 'Param Sundari' for showing a romantic, flirty scene in the film. Reportedly, the group has demanded in writing that the scene be taken out of the movie.The report further stated that the group has written to the Mumbai Police, the Central Board of Film Certification, the Information and Broadcasting Ministry, and the Maharashtra government demanding the same. It wants the scene to be removed not just from the movie but also from the promotional videos, trailer, and songs.The lawyer of the Watchdog Foundation told the publication, "The CBFC, established under the Cinematograph Act, 1952, is entrusted with certifying films while taking into account both artistic expression and respect for religious feelings."In the letter, the group mentioned that the church is a sacred place of worship for all the Christians, and showing "indecent content" at such a place would offend the community. The letter read, "This portrayal not only disrespects the spiritual sanctity of the religious place of worship but also deeply offends the sensibilities of the Catholic community."Group questions CBFC and demands FIRThe group questioned how the scene was cleared by the CBFC and warned against protesting the film if it's not dropped from the film. Not just that, they also demanded an FIR to be registered against the producer, director, and actors for hurting the Catholic community.More about 'Param Sundari'The film directed by Tushar Jalota is backed by Dinesh Vijan's production house. Starring Sidharth and Janhvi in the lead, it is scheduled to hit cinemas on August 29, 2025."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousThe Life of a Showgirl: A look back at Shahid celebrates 16 years of Kaminey with nostalgic post
'Kaminey', starring Shahid Kapoor and Priyanka Chopra, celebrated its 16th anniversary with a nostalgic video shared by Shahid. The 2009 film, set in Mumbai’s underworld, features twin brothers in rivalry. Meanwhile, Shahid’s Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj biopic was shelved due to industry challenges, confirmed by director Amit Rai.

The 2009 film, set in Mumbai’s underworld, features twin brothers in rivalry. Meanwhile, Shahid’s Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj biopic was shelved due to industry challenges, confirmed by director Amit Rai. 'Kaminey', starring Shahid Kapoor and Priyanka Chopra, celebrated its 16th anniversary with a nostalgic video shared by Shahid. The 2009 film, set in Mumbai’s underworld, features twin brothers in rivalry. Meanwhile, Shahid’s Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj biopic was shelved due to industry challenges, confirmed by director Amit Rai. The film ‘Kaminey’, featuring Shahid Kapoor and Priyanka Chopra, recently marked its 16th anniversary. To mark the occasion, Shahid posted a nostalgic video on his social media, highlighting memorable moments from Vishal Bhardwaj’s direction. Fans quickly responded with heartfelt messages and fond recollections of the beloved cult favorite.Nostalgic video shared on InstagramOn his Instagram, Shahid posted a video featuring a compilation of the film’s most memorable scenes. He captioned it, “फ़ फ़ फ़ फ़ फ़ फोलाह saal poore. #Kaminey." Fans expressed their admiration, with one saying, “Iconic!!!! Forever," and another praising him as, “original and pure superstar meterial actor @shahidkapoor."About the film ‘Kaminey’Released in 2009, the action-packed film ‘Kaminey’ was crafted by writer-director Vishal Bhardwaj and produced by Ronnie Screwvala under UTV Motion Pictures. The film also featured Priyanka Chopra and Amole Gupte in prominent roles. Set amid the chaotic Mumbai underworld, the story revolves around twin brothers, one with a lisp, the other with a stutter, entangled in a fierce rivalry unfolding within a single day. Bhardwaj also composed the movie’s soundtrack, with Gulzar penning the lyrics. The album, containing eight tracks, became widely popular, boasting hits like ‘Dhan Te Nan’, ‘Fatak’, ‘Raat Ke Dhai Baje’, and ‘Pehli Baar Mohabbat’.Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj biopic shelvedMeanwhile, the much-anticipated Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj project starring Shahid Kapoor has been officially cancelled. Director Amit Rai, famous for ‘OMG 2’, confirmed this development in an interview with Mid-Day, voicing his disappointment over the harsh realities and systemic challenges within the film industry."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Adah stands by National Film Award wins for 'The Kerala Story'
Adah Sharma defends 'The Kerala Story' after it won National Awards for Best Direction and Cinematography, amidst controversy over its alleged propaganda. Sharma asserts it's her responsibility to share the victims' stories, having met numerous girls who experienced similar horrors. She dismisses claims of political motivation, emphasizing the film's focus on the plight of trafficked and brainwashed women.
Adah Sharma stands by National Film Award wins for 'The Kerala Story': 'I don't mind being shameless' | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodAdah Sharma stands by National Film Award wins for 'The Kerala Story': 'I don't mind being shameless'TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionAdah Sharma stands by National Film Award wins for 'The Kerala Story': 'I don't mind being shameless'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 12:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAdah Sharma defends 'The Kerala Story' after it won National Awards for Best Direction and Cinematography, amidst controversy over its alleged propaganda. Sharma asserts it's her responsibility to share the victims' stories, having met numerous girls who experienced similar horrors. She dismisses claims of political motivation, emphasizing the film's focus on the plight of trafficked and brainwashed women.  'The Kerala Story' bagged the honors in the Best Direction and Best Cinematography categories at the 71st National Film Awards. However, this didn't go well with a lot of people, as they felt that it was a propaganda movie. Now, the actress, Adah Sharma, has defended the film, saying it is her "responsibility" to bring the victim's stories into the forefront.Adah Sharma reacts to backlash on the film winning National AwardsIn an interview with the Hindustan Times, talking about the backlash after it won the National Awards, Adah Sharma said that if telling the truth is shameful, then "I don't mind being shameless." The actress said that she has no shame in saying that she doesn't support terrorism. She said, "People who are calling it shameful—I think it has hit a nerve, and I don’t think nerves are hit by lies."Adah Sharma Stuns In BandraAdah Sharma shares she felt responsible for telling the stories of the victimAdah shared that everyone is allowed to have their opinion. She added that it would have been "shameful" if they had not made the film. The actress went on to reveal that she has met 25 girls who went through all the horrors shown in the film. Adah even stated that the movie is still a diluted version of what they experience in real life.The actress expressed that after meeting the girls, she felt that it was her "responsibility to tell their story."Adah Sharma reacts to claims of the film being 'politically motivated'Adah Sharma, in the same interview, dismissed the claims that the film was politically motivated. She stated that there was no mention of any political party or a leader. She told the publication that the film was the story about the girls who were "trafficked, brainwashed, and taken to become terrorists." She said, "I stand with these girls. If that is political, then so be it."More about 'The Kerala Story'The film tells the story of three women who are forced to convert to Islam and later join ISIS. Adah played one of three in the film. Directed by Sudipto Sen, it was released in theaters in May 2023. Reportedly, the film earned over Rs 300 crore at the box office worldwide."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. John says 'Tehran‘ is made with cultural sensitivity
John Abraham stars in 'Tehran,' a high-stakes international thriller set in Iran, a country with which he shares a personal connection. Abraham emphasizes the film's sensitivity in portraying Iran and Israel, aiming for balance and avoiding exaggerated action. He believes 'Tehran' is a significant Indian film, exploring diverse cultures and languages.
'Tehran' star John Abraham says film has been crafted with sincerity: ‘We have been very sensitive to how people feel about Iran, and also how India is portrayed’ - Exclusive | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood'Tehran' star John Abraham says film has been crafted with sincerity: ‘We have been very sensitive to how people feel about Iran, and also how India is portrayed’ - ExclusiveTrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office Collection'Tehran' star John Abraham says film has been crafted with sincerity: ‘We have been very sensitive to how people feel about Iran, and also how India is portrayed’ - ExclusiveTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 12:29 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeJohn Abraham stars in 'Tehran,' a high-stakes international thriller set in Iran, a country with which he shares a personal connection. Abraham emphasizes the film's sensitivity in portraying Iran and Israel, aiming for balance and avoiding exaggerated action. He believes 'Tehran' is a significant Indian film, exploring diverse cultures and languages.  John Abraham, the Bollywood hunk, is known for bringing his ‘A’ game with every action thriller, and ‘Tehran’ is no exception. However, this time, he has walked an extra mile, as ‘Tehran’ is not your typical gun-blazing spectacle; this time, the high-stakes thriller spans countries, colours, and languages. “‘Tehran,’ I can confidently say, is one of the most significant and biggest international films out of India,” said John Abraham in his exclusive conversation with us.“We’ve spoken different languages, explored different cultures, and it’s been a fantastic experience,” added the actor.John Abraham reveals why he says no to bollywood parties—and yes to a 4 am wake-up callThe film is set primarily in Iran, and John Abraham has a personal connection to the country, as his mother has relatives there. When asked if his connection helped him to understand the subject matter better, the actor shared, “I believe Iran is arguably the most misrepresented country in the world.” John Abraham says the film has been crafted with sincerityHe continued, “Yes, of course, there’s a big question mark over the regime, but the people of Iran are beautiful—and that’s what I believe. We still have cousins there, and it’s a place I would want to visit. Naturally, I want to see a deeply balanced film. In our film, we’ve been very sensitive to how people feel about Iran, how people feel about Israel—especially since some of my closest friends are from Israel—and also how India is portrayed."Speaking on the subject of sensitivity, the actor also highlighted that to stay true to the movie, the team avoided any stylized or exaggerated action. “There was a temptation to go over the top, to add in those action sequences. But we steered clear of that and made the most honest film we could," concluded John Abraham.About ‘Tehran’Based on the 2012 attacks on Israeli diplomats, ‘Tehran’ is an Arun Gopalan directorial. Released on Zee5 on August 14, the movie stars John Abraham, Neeru Bajwa, and Manushi Chhillar in the lead roles. Tehran - Official Trailer"Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. 'Border 2' first look reactions: Sunny’s soldier avatar sparks fan frenzy
On India's 79th Independence Day, the first look of 'Border 2' was unveiled, igniting immense excitement among fans. Sunny Deol returns in his iconic role, promising another patriotic blockbuster set to release on January 22, 2026. The film, directed by Anurag Singh, features a stellar cast including Varun Dhawan and Diljit Dosanjh, fueling anticipation for a massive cinematic event.
'Border 2' first look reactions: Sunny Deol’s soldier avatar sparks fan frenzy; netizens hail it as an all-time blockbuster | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood'Border 2' first look reactions: Sunny Deol’s soldier avatar sparks fan frenzy; netizens hail it as an all-time blockbusterTrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office Collection'Border 2' first look reactions: Sunny Deol’s soldier avatar sparks fan frenzy; netizens hail it as an all-time blockbusterTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 12:20 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeOn India's 79th Independence Day, the first look of 'Border 2' was unveiled, igniting immense excitement among fans. Sunny Deol returns in his iconic role, promising another patriotic blockbuster set to release on January 22, 2026. The film, directed by Anurag Singh, features a stellar cast including Varun Dhawan and Diljit Dosanjh, fueling anticipation for a massive cinematic event.  On the occasion of 79th Independence Day, fans of Bollywood’s most iconic war drama got the gift they’ve been waiting for, the first look of 'Border 2'. The makers dropped the poster on August 15, confirming that the much-awaited sequel will release on January 22, 2026, perfectly aligning with the extended Republic Day weekend.Here's a closer look.Varun Dhawan wraps 'Border 2' with cake and Golden Temple blessings'Border 2' posterThe 'Border 2' poster instantly sent a wave of nostalgia across the internet. Sunny Deol, dressed in full army gear, a bazooka slung over his shoulder, and his trademark fiery glare locked in place, looks every bit the war hero audiences fell in love with back in 1997’s Border. Sharing the image on Instagram, Sunny wrote, “Hindustan ke liye ladenge… phir ek baar!”, setting the tone for another patriotic blockbuster.Fans flood social media with love for 'Border 2'Within minutes, social media exploded with reactions. One user declared, “भारत माता की जय!”, while another called it the “Hindustan Ki Asli Wali All Time Blockbuster — 100 Cr first day sure shot! Taiyaari kar lo dosto, #SunnyPaaji ka tehalka ek baar fir machne vala hai… Jai Hind… Jai Hind ki sena!”Others kept it short and emotional — “Jai Hind” wrote one, “Wow love you sir ji” penned another, while someone else simply commented, “Eagerly waiting "Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Farah calls Sunita Ahuja ‘most entertaining biwi’
Sunita Ahuja, Govinda’s wife, debuted on YouTube with her first vlog, receiving praise from celebrities like Farah Khan and Suniel Shetty. Her teaser featured a bold entrance and addressed divorce rumors. Sunita’s candid and entertaining style has quickly captured viewers’ attention and support across social media.
Farah Khan hails Govinda’s wife Sunita Ahuja in her debut vlog, calls her ‘most entertaining biwi’ | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodFarah Khan hails Govinda’s wife Sunita Ahuja in her debut vlog, calls her ‘most entertaining biwi’TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionFarah Khan hails Govinda’s wife Sunita Ahuja in her debut vlog, calls her ‘most entertaining biwi’TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 12:21 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSunita Ahuja, Govinda’s wife, debuted on YouTube with her first vlog, receiving praise from celebrities like Farah Khan and Suniel Shetty. Her teaser featured a bold entrance and addressed divorce rumors. Sunita’s candid and entertaining style has quickly captured viewers’ attention and support across social media. Sunita Ahuja, Govinda’s wife, debuted on YouTube with her first vlog, receiving praise from celebrities like Farah Khan and Suniel Shetty. Her teaser featured a bold entrance and addressed divorce rumors. Sunita’s candid and entertaining style has quickly captured viewers’ attention and support across social media. Govinda’s wife Sunita Ahuja, known for her bold and lively nature, has made her debut on YouTube with her very first vlog released yesterday. Following the teaser, many celebrities, including Farah Khan and Suniel Shetty, showed their support. Farah, who shares popular cooking videos with her chef Dilip, praised Sunita as the most entertaining wife in Bollywood, while Suniel appreciated her for staying true to herself without any apologies.Farah Khan’s Daughter Diva Looks Like Mini Alia Bhatt In Viral Portugal PicFarah Khan and Suniel Shetty show their supportFarah eagerly welcomed Sunita to the YouTube platform by sharing the teaser of her debut vlog. Praising the content, Khan called her the “Most entertaining biwi!! Now on YouTube," and encouraged her followers to watch it. At the same time, Suniel Shetty took to Instagram stories to cheer Sunita on, writing, “YouTube India, brace yourself! Sunita Ahuja- only you can be unapologetically YOU- raw, honest, and downright entertaining. And now the world’s about to get hooked. This is gonna be less watch & chill and more laugh till I spill!”.Teaser highlights Sunita’s bold entranceOn Instagram yesterday, Sunita gave a sneak peek of her first YouTube vlog, captioning it, “Biwi No 1 aab aa chuki hai youtube channel par please jake dekho mere youtube video link in bio like karo share karo subscribe kardoo and comment me batao kaisa laga aapko." The teaser features Sunita making a grand entrance with the song ‘Biwi No. 1’ playing. She introduces herself to viewers, saying, “Hi guys, this is Sunita. Aap dekh rahe ho mujhe YouTube channel par. Sabne paise kamaya, aab meri baari hai. Aab main kamaungi. Chaapungi." The video closes with her proudly displaying her collection of gold jewelry.Sunita addresses divorce rumours in first vlogThe teaser gives a glimpse of Sunita’s first vlog, where she plans to address the rumours about her divorce from Govinda. She says, “Yeh ek saal mere liye bahut difficult raha hai. Pata nahi kitne logo ne kya kya bakwaas kiya hai mere baare mein." In the video, she is also shown purchasing alcohol, adding, “Yeh mat sochna yeh mere liye le rahe hu main. Sab sochege hum bhi bewari hai bhai.""Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. Kriti CONFIRMED as female lead in 'Cocktail 2'
Kriti Sanon has confirmed her leading role in 'Cocktail 2', as revealed through Homi Adajania's Instagram post, generating excitement among fans. The sequel to the 2012 hit is set to feature a fresh cast, with rumours suggesting Shahid Kapoor and Rashmika Mandanna may join Sanon. 'Cocktail 2' is expected to hit theaters in the latter half of 2026.
Kriti Sanon CONFIRMED as female lead in Homi Adajania's 'Cocktail 2'; says 'This is gonna be a liberating journey' | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodKriti Sanon CONFIRMED as female lead in Homi Adajania's 'Cocktail 2'; says 'This is gonna be a liberating journey'TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionKriti Sanon CONFIRMED as female lead in Homi Adajania's 'Cocktail 2'; says 'This is gonna be a liberating journey'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 11:57 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeKriti Sanon has confirmed her leading role in 'Cocktail 2', as revealed through Homi Adajania's Instagram post, generating excitement among fans. The sequel to the 2012 hit is set to feature a fresh cast, with rumours suggesting Shahid Kapoor and Rashmika Mandanna may join Sanon. 'Cocktail 2' is expected to hit theaters in the latter half of 2026.  After months of rumours and casting buzz, Kriti Sanon has finally confirmed her leading role in the upcoming film 'Cocktail 2'.The AnnouncementThe actress' confirmation about bagging the lead role in the romantic drama came via Homi Adajania’s Instagram story. The director posted a photo of Kriti, but hid her face behind a “Work in Progress” sticker. Not one to leave fans guessing any longer, the director added a caption tagging “@kritisanon #TheSicilianChapter #Cocktail2.”Kriti Sanon Recreates Iconic Zeenat Moment, Fans Can’t Keep CalmKriti's ConfirmationIt wasn't long before the leading lady reacted to the post by posting it on her stories and writing, “This is gonna be a liberating journey… I can feel it.” With this, the sequel is getting green-lit nearly thirteen years after 'Cocktail' first released back in 2012. The film starring Deepika Padukone, Saif Ali Khan and Diana Penty charmed audiences with its blend of romance and comedy. The sequel, however, will feature a fresh cast, with Kriti now in the lead. While the cast has not yet been announced, rumours are rife that it will star Shahid Kapoor and Rashmika Mandanna. If the rumours are true, this will mark Kriti and Shahid’s second collaboration after their 2024 romantic sci-fi hit 'Teri Baaton Mein Aisa Uljha Jiya'.Release Date'Cocktail 2' is reportedly eyeing a theatrical release in the second half of 2026. Kriti's Other Film ProjectsOn the work front, Kriti is awaiting the release of her film 'Tere Ishq Mein' and is also said to be starring in the Hindi remake of 'Kill Bill'. She is also rumoured to be the top pick for the upcoming film 'Don 3', opposite Ranveer Singh, however, an official confirmation is still awaited. "Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. Ahaan marks 79th Independence Day amid blockbuster success
Ahaan Panday celebrated Indian Independence Day as his debut film, 'Saiyaara', continues to succeed. His mother, Deanne Panday, shared celebration photos on Instagram with a Gandhi quote. Netflix bought streaming rights but postponed the release to Diwali, extending the film’s theatrical run and reaching a larger festive audience.

His mother, Deanne Panday, shared celebration photos on Instagram with a Gandhi quote. Netflix bought streaming rights but postponed the release to Diwali, extending the film’s theatrical run and reaching a larger festive audience. Ahaan Panday celebrated Indian Independence Day as his debut film, 'Saiyaara', continues to succeed. His mother, Deanne Panday, shared celebration photos on Instagram with a Gandhi quote. Netflix bought streaming rights but postponed the release to Diwali, extending the film’s theatrical run and reaching a larger festive audience. Ahaan Panday marked the Indian Independence Day celebrations with joy, riding high on the success of his first film, ‘Saiyaara’. His mother, Deanne Panday, took to Instagram on Friday to share several pictures from the festivities held at their Mumbai home. In these images, Ahaan is seen enjoying the moment alongside his pet, dressed in a crisp white shirt. The vibrant colors of the Indian flag added to the festive atmosphere in the background.Here's a closer look.Deanne Panday shares inspirational quote on InstagramDeanne, in the caption of her Instagram post, chose to highlight Mahatma Gandhi’s powerful words: “You must be the change you wish to see in the world". She then added, “Proud to be Indian! Happy Independence Day.".‘Saiyaara’ plot and appeal‘Saiyaara’ centers on the journey of Krish Kapoor, a passionate singer, and Vaani Batra, an up-and-coming journalist. Their growing love story is tested by various challenges along the way. With a captivating soundtrack that has struck a chord with listeners, the movie skillfully weaves together themes of romance, dreams, and heartfelt drama. Both critics and audiences have warmly embraced the film.Netflix acquires streaming rights for 'Saiyaara,' digital release delayedAccording to reports, Netflix has purchased the streaming rights for ‘Saiyaara’. However, because the movie is still performing well at the box office, its online release has been pushed back to around Diwali. The move is intended to maximize the film’s time in theaters and attract more viewers during the festive season when it becomes available for streaming.About 'Saiyaara'A soulful musical drama directed by Mohit Suri, 'Saiyaara' stars newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda. The film narrates the heartbreaking story of a troubled musician and a shy poet who find love, only to have their bond tested by a tragic turn of events.
