'Border 2': Sunny Deol announces release date
Sunny Deol ignited patriotic fervor on India's 79th Independence Day by unveiling the first poster of 'Border 2,' the sequel to the 1997 classic. Deol returns in his iconic role, with the film slated for release on January 22, 2026, coinciding with the Republic Day weekend.
'Border 2': Sunny Deol unveils fiery first poster on Independence Day; announces 22 January 2026 release: 'Hindustan ke liye ladenge....phir ek baar!' | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywood'Border 2': Sunny Deol unveils fiery first poster on Independence Day; announces 22 January 2026 release: 'Hindustan ke liye ladenge....phir ek baar!'TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office Collection'Border 2': Sunny Deol unveils fiery first poster on Independence Day; announces 22 January 2026 release: 'Hindustan ke liye ladenge....phir ek baar!'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 10:35 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSunny Deol ignited patriotic fervor on India's 79th Independence Day by unveiling the first poster of 'Border 2,' the sequel to the 1997 classic. Deol returns in his iconic role, with the film slated for release on January 22, 2026, coinciding with the Republic Day weekend.  On the occasion of India’s 79th Independence Day, Sunny Deol kept the spirit of patriotism high as he unveiled the first poster of his upcoming movie 'Border 2'. Poster and Release DateBesides launching the new poster and paying due tribute to the country’s soldiers, he announced that the highly anticipated sequel to the 1997 classic will hit cinemas on 22 January 2026, coinciding with the extended Republic Day weekend.Sunny Deol Meets Dalai Lama| Picture Goes ViralThe poster marks the return of Deol in his iconic role. The fiery new poster features the actor front and centre in his military avatar, firing a bazooka. Sharing the image, he wrote, "Hindustan ke liye ladenge....phir ek baar! #Border2 hits theatres on Jan 22, 2026 #HappyIndependenceDay!"Border 2 CastDirected by Anurag Singh, 'Border 2' features an ensemble cast including Varun Dhawan, Diljit Dosanjh, Ahan Shetty, Medha Rana, Mona Singh, and Sonam Bajwa. On Film's Republic Day ReleaseProducer Bhushan Kumar said in a statement, “Border is more than a film — it’s an emotion for every Indian. With Border 2, we aim to carry forward that legacy and bring it to a new generation. The new release date gives audiences more time to come together and experience the film in theatres during an extended Republic Day weekend.”Speaking to Deadline, director Anurag Singh called the Independence Day announcement “symbolic”, adding, "This day reminds us of the sacrifices made by our soldiers for India’s freedom and so does our film. It’s an honour and a privilege to honour their undying spirit through this story.”"Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. When Armaan Malik said: 'Every man wants two wives'
YouTuber Armaan Malik, along with his wives Payal and Kritika Malik, has been summoned by a Patiala court regarding legal cases. Malik faces allegations of violating the Hindu Marriage Act by allegedly having four marriages. Additionally, Payal Malik is accused of hurting religious sentiments by dressing as the Hindu goddess Kali in a video.
Armaan Malik summoned by Patiala Court: When YouTuber shut down criticism on second marriage saying 'Every man wants to have two wives' | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodArmaan Malik summoned by Patiala Court: When YouTuber shut down criticism on second marriage saying 'Every man wants to have two wives'TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan Malik summoned by Patiala Court: When YouTuber shut down criticism on second marriage saying 'Every man wants to have two wives'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 15, 2025, 09:32 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeYouTuber Armaan Malik, along with his wives Payal and Kritika Malik, has been summoned by a Patiala court regarding legal cases. Malik faces allegations of violating the Hindu Marriage Act by allegedly having four marriages. Additionally, Payal Malik is accused of hurting religious sentiments by dressing as the Hindu goddess Kali in a video.  YouTuber and Bigg Boss OTT 3 contestant Armaan Malik, along with his wives Payal Malik and Kritika Malik, have been summoned by a Patiala district court in connection with two separate legal cases. According to reports on news portals, the court has directed all three to appear on 2 September.At a time when the YouTuber is in the midst of controversy over his personal life and alleged four marriages, just last year, during his stint on Bigg Boss OTT 3, Malik opened up to ETimes TV and described entering the reality show with both wives as a “historic” moment. On His Bigg Boss Stint“This is going to go down in Bigg Boss history that we entered the show together and I was able to handle things well with them. Also, Payal and Kritika are very sensible, strong, and capable of standing up for themselves,” he said.On Criticism Over 2 WivesResponding to criticism over his marital choices, Malik added, “I am not here to change anyone’s thinking or mindset. I just want to take care of my home and my wives. Everyone’s life is different. Every man wants to have two wives in their life, but it doesn’t happen for most because they can’t handle the first one.”About The Legal DramaThe summons follows a petition filed by Davinder Rajput, who has alleged that Malik has entered into four marriages, in violation of the Hindu Marriage Act, which allows only one marriage at a time for individuals practising Hinduism.In addition to the bigamy allegations, the petition accuses Armaan and Payal Malik of hurting religious sentiments. It claims that Payal appeared dressed as the Hindu goddess Kali in an Instagram video, sparking outrage. The petitioner argues that this act was offensive to religious beliefs and constitutes a punishable offence under Indian law.Investigations into the allegations are ongoing."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Whether it's the rise of a new sensation or the seasoned journey of an industry veteran, the TOI Entertainment Desk is your front-row seat to the fascinating narratives that shape the entertainment landscape. Beyond the breaking news, we present a celebration of culture. We explore the intersections of entertainment with society, politics, and everyday life.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousRubina Dilaik's powerful reality show Akshay shares patriotic message on 79th Independence Day
Akshay Kumar celebrated India's 79th Independence Day with a heartfelt message on Instagram, showcasing his patriotic spirit. Known for films like 'Holiday,' 'Baby,' and 'Kesari' that evoke national pride, he won a National Award for 'Rustom.' Kumar is now preparing for 'Jolly LLB 3,' a courtroom comedy-drama, where he will reunite with Arshad Warsi for a humorous legal showdown.
Akshay Kumar shares patriotic message on 79th Independence Day: 'Here’s to the freedom that defines us' | Hindi Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodAkshay Kumar shares patriotic message on 79th Independence Day: 'Here’s to the freedom that defines us'TrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionAkshay Kumar shares patriotic message on 79th Independence Day: 'Here’s to the freedom that defines us'TOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 10:18 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAkshay Kumar celebrated India's 79th Independence Day with a heartfelt message on Instagram, showcasing his patriotic spirit. Known for films like 'Holiday,' 'Baby,' and 'Kesari' that evoke national pride, he won a National Award for 'Rustom.' Kumar is now preparing for 'Jolly LLB 3,' a courtroom comedy-drama, where he will reunite with Arshad Warsi for a humorous legal showdown.  On the occasion of India’s 79th Independence Day, Bollywood star Akshay Kumar took to his Instagram Stories to share his warm wishes with fans and fellow countrymen. The actor posted a striking photo of India Gate adorned with the national flag and added a heartfelt message that read, “Happy Independence Day. Here’s to the freedom that defines us and the pride that unites us. Swatantra Diwas ki shubkamna, Jai Hind.”PM Modi's Stern Warning to Pakistan After Nuclear Threat, Refuses To Resume Indus Waters TreatyFilms that stirred National prideAkshay’s journey into patriotic storytelling began with 'Holiday: A Soldier Is Never Off Duty' (2014), where he played an Army officer. This was followed by 'Baby' (2015) and later in 'Naam Shabana', in which he portrayed an undercover agent determined to protect the nation.National Award WinnerHis portrayal of a naval officer in 'Rustom'(2016), inspired by a real-life case, won him the National Film Award for Best Actor. In 'Kesari' (2019), he played Havildar Ishar Singh, leading the iconic Battle of Saragarhi. Films like 'Airlift' (2016) also carried strong messages.The 'Khiladi' star was last seen in 'Sky Force', a film based on the Indian Air Force’s historic missions.PollWhat’s the best part of Independence Day for you?The patriotic spiritThe sense of togethernessNext Bollywood ventureAkshay Kumar is all set to make a comeback with 'Jolly LLB 3', a courtroom comedy-drama directed by Subhash Kapoor. He will reunite with Arshad Warsi, with both actors stepping back into their famous 'Jolly' roles. This time, the story will bring them face-to-face in a funny and chaotic legal battle that promises even more laughs and drama."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Chance the Rapper opens up about Kristen split
Chance the Rapper is set to release his new album, Star Line, in August 2025 and embark on the And We Back tour in September 2025. He candidly discussed his divorce from Kristen Corley on a podcast, emphasizing their commitment to co-parenting their two daughters, Kensli and Marlie.
Chance the Rapper opens up about Kristen Corley split ahead of album release | English Movie News - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardsNewsentertainmentenglishmusicChance the Rapper opens up about Kristen Corley split ahead of album releaseTrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionChance the Rapper opens up about Kristen Corley split ahead of album releaseTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 15, 2025, 06:35 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeChance the Rapper is set to release his new album, Star Line, in August 2025 and embark on the And We Back tour in September 2025. He candidly discussed his divorce from Kristen Corley on a podcast, emphasizing their commitment to co-parenting their two daughters, Kensli and Marlie.  Chance the Rapper is gearing up to release his new album, Star Line, on August 15, 2025. In a recent interaction, he revealed details of his upcoming And We Back tour, set to kick off in September 2025 in support of the album. However, it’s not just his music making headlines. During an appearance on the New Rory & Mal podcast, the rapper also spoke candidly about his personal life and his divorce from Kristen Corley.Split after five years of marriageChance and Kristen parted ways in 2024 after being married for five years. He shared that he’s currently in a “transition” period and still learning and growing.Love and Family Bonds RemainDespite their split, Chance said they “definitely love each other.” Coming from a close-knit family, he believes it’s important for him, Kristen, and their families to stay connected and get along well.Separation from Kristen CorleyChance revealed that even though they’re separated, he and Kristen still travel together, but their relationship has a very different dynamic now.From deep love to divorceThe two first met at the age of nine and tied the knot in 2019. They have two daughters, Kensli (9) and Marlie (5). Chance and Kristen shared a strong bond, but five years into their marriage, they faced challenges they couldn’t overcome. This eventually led to what Chance describes as an “amicable” divorce.A Difficult JourneySpeaking on the New Rory & Mal podcast, Chance admitted, "I ain't gonna act like it’s not tough. I ain’t gonna act like it’s perfect and we shook hands and dipped. It’s weird. I think the toughness is that it’s a reality. I think that’s the toughest part. You might feel like you’re over it, and you’re not over it. Or you might be used to a certain pattern of operating, and because it doesn’t work like that, you have to allow yourself grace to deal with that and operate in reality."Mutual respectChance shared that he and Kristen maintain mutual respect, which allows them to keep a friendly relationship. They often visit the same places and see each other at least every other week. He noted that, unlike some separated couples who completely cut off contact.Connected through their kidsChance explained that having children means he and Kristen will always share an emotional connection. He compared it to a Venn diagram, where they are both linked through the same centre, their kids. While admitting they may not be the most emotionally mature people, he said they share the understanding that helps them avoid letting conflicts go too far. He added that he’s grateful to have a co-parent who shares this mindset.Chance The Rapper is such a family man!"Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. No red carpet goes unrolled, no stage goes dark - our team spans the globe, bringing you the latest scoops and insider insights from Bollywood to Hollywood, and every entertainment hotspot in between. We don't just report; we tell tales of stardom and stories untold. Ahaan and Aneet SPOTTED on dinner and movie date: WATCH
Amidst the buzz surrounding 'War 2' and 'Coolie', 'Saiyaara' stars Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda sparked relationship rumors with a cozy date night. Spotted at a Mumbai restaurant and later at a 'Saiyaara' screening, their off-screen chemistry mirrored their on-screen romance.
Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda SPOTTED together on date night; co-stars grab dinner and watch 'Saiyaara' at theatre amid 'War 2' and 'Coolie' release - WATCH | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomecinemanewsmovie reviewsmovie listingsbox officeanimepreviewsdid you knowvideosshowtimesblogsawardshindienglishtamiltelugumalayalamkannadabengalipunjabimarathibhojpuriGujaratiNewsentertainmenthindibollywoodAhaan Panday and Aneet Padda SPOTTED together on date night; co-stars grab dinner and watch 'Saiyaara' at theatre amid 'War 2' and 'Coolie' release - WATCHTrendingArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionArmaan MalikWar 2 ReviewCoolie ReviewMrunal ThakurGauri KhanCooliePriyanka ChopraJaya BachchanSaiyaara Box Office CollectionSon of Sardaar 2 Box Office CollectionAhaan Panday and Aneet Padda SPOTTED together on date night; co-stars grab dinner and watch 'Saiyaara' at theatre amid 'War 2' and 'Coolie' release - WATCHTOI Entertainment Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 09:04 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAmidst the buzz surrounding 'War 2' and 'Coolie', 'Saiyaara' stars Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda sparked relationship rumors with a cozy date night. Spotted at a Mumbai restaurant and later at a 'Saiyaara' screening, their off-screen chemistry mirrored their on-screen romance.  Amid the release frenzy of 'War 2' and 'Coolie', 'Saiyaara' co-stars Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda were spotted enjoying a cosy date night together.According to viral clips doing the rounds online, the pair was spotted stepping out for a quiet dinner at a plush city restaurant, further igniting chatter about a possible relationship.Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda’s chemistry steals the show at 'Saiyaara' success bashReportedly, the two also headed to a Mumbai theatre to catch the final screening of their blockbuster 'Saiyaara' on the big screen. In the video, Ahaan was seen playing the perfect gentleman, purchasing tickets for himself and Aneet before leading the way into the cinema hall, all while being trailed by paparazzi. The sighting only fuelled speculation that the sizzling on-screen romance between the two may have found its way into real life.Meanwhile, contradictory reports online state that the couple headed out to catch a screening of 'War 2', however, fans were convinced that they went to watch their movie after watching a video where the actor can be heard asking for 'Saiyaara' tickets.On the business front, 'Saiyaara', which has earned an estimated Rs 322 crore at the box office, is now nearing the end of its theatrical run. With the arrival of Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR’s 'War 2' and Rajinikanth’s 'Coolie', the film’s collections have taken a sharp dip, falling to just Rs 25 lakh on its latest day, its first drop below the Rs 1 crore mark.While the production house is yet to make an official announcement, YRF casting director Shanoo Sharma added to the excitement by resharing post on her social media, revealing that 'Saiyaara' will begin streaming on Netflix from 12 September 2025."Get the latest news updates on Times of India, including reviews of the movie Coolie and War 2."About the AuthorTOI Entertainment DeskThe TOI Entertainment Desk is a dynamic and dedicated team of journalists, working tirelessly to bring the pulse of the entertainment world straight to the readers of The Times of India. THIS simple, no tool home test is said to predict a brain tumor!
The examination sometimes goes by the name of dysdiadochokinesia assessment, because it tests rapid alternating movement abilities. The test requires you to position your hands on your thighs while performing repeated palm flips upwards, then downwards, or to perform rapid thumb tapping between your fingers in sequence followed by sequence reversal
THIS simple, no tool home test is said to predict a brain tumor, amongst other conditions; here's how - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsTHIS simple, no tool home test is said to predict a brain tumor, amongst other conditions; here's howTrendingIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHappy Krishna JanmashtamiKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHappy Krishna JanmashtamiKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHappy Krishna JanmashtamiKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesTHIS simple, no tool home test is said to predict a brain tumor, amongst other conditions; here's howTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 15, 2025, 13:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe examination sometimes goes by the name of dysdiadochokinesia assessment, because it tests rapid alternating movement abilities. The test requires you to position your hands on your thighs while performing repeated palm flips upwards, then downwards, or to perform rapid thumb tapping between your fingers in sequence followed by sequence reversal  You do not (always) have to get an invasive test done to gauge the health of your brain. If you are otherwise healthy, some really simple home tests can also tell you if all is okay in the brain. Wondering how? Let's take a look...The RAM testThe Rapid Alternate Movement (RAM) test is a basic neurological examination, which evaluates the brain-muscle coordination needed to create smooth coordinated movements. The test targets the cerebellum, which functions as the control center for balance together with muscle coordination, and precise movement execution. During the RAM test, you need to perform quick hand flipping motions or finger tapping patterns. Difficulty with smooth and fast test performance can indicate problems in the brain or nervous system that result from cerebellar dysfunction, which often appears after injuries, strokes and brain-related medical conditions.What is the Rapid Alternate Movement testThe RAM test evaluates your capability to execute fast repetitive movements using your hands or feet. The examination sometimes goes by the name of dysdiadochokinesia assessment, because it tests rapid alternating movement abilities. The test requires you to position your hands on your thighs while performing repeated palm flips upwards, then downwards, or to perform rapid thumb tapping between your fingers in sequence followed by sequence reversal. The assessment evaluates how fluidly and rapidly you perform the movements. Slow, uncoordinated or clumsy movements during the test can suggest problems with the cerebellum. Doctors utilise this examination to evaluate brain operations and coordination, primarily focusing on the cerebellum.How to perform the RAM test at homeThe RAM test has a home version which helps you evaluate your motor skills and coordination abilities. Here’s how:Sit comfortably on a chair with your feet flat on the ground and your hands resting on your thighs.Place your hands flat on your thighs with the palms down.Perform quick hand movements by facing your palms up and then immediately facing them back down toward the bottom. Perform these movements as quickly and smoothly as possible for 10 seconds.The finger tapping version of the test requires you to touch your thumb tip to your index finger tip followed by middle finger tip then ring finger tip and pinky tip before repeating the sequence in reverse order. Execute these movements with maximum speed and fluidity for the entire 10 seconds.Test each hand separately before combining them into a single hand operation.Medical evaluation of your brain coordination centers becomes necessary when you experience either speed difficulties, or unsteady movements during the test.What does the RAM Test tell youThe RAM test functions as a brief assessment tool to evaluate motor coordination capabilities of your brain. Rapid alternating movement problems usually indicate cerebellum, or its connection pathway abnormalities. The conditions of stroke, brain injuries, multiple sclerosis and tumors that impact brain coordination, tend to cause this type of problem. The RAM test cannot diagnose diseases directly, but indicates that you should seek professional neurological evaluation if you experience any difficulty with the test, especially when combined with dizziness, imbalance or weakness.Limitations of the RAM TestThe RAM test functions as a single component within a complete neurological examination. The test fails to identify the specific nature of the issue, or its precise brain location. Your test performance can be influenced by stress together with tiredness, as well as nutritional deficiencies. However, the test cannot give any precise results on any condition.Sources:https://wtcs.pressbooks.pub/nursingskills/chapter/6-8-assessing-cerebellar-function/https://med.stanford.edu/stanfordmedicine25/the25/cerebellar.htmlhttps://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK559262/Disclaimer: This article is informational only and not a substitute for medical adviceGet the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Happy Independence Day wishes, messages, and quotes !About the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. Making THESE changes in the diet can lower blood pressure
A recent study highlights the significant benefits of a diet rich in fruits and vegetables for individuals with hypertension. The research demonstrates that incorporating more fruits and vegetables into one's diet can effectively lower blood pressure, improve kidney health, and reduce cardiovascular disease risk. Unlike sodium bicarbonate, fruits and vegetables achieve these benefits while potentially reducing the need for medication.
Hypertension: Making THESE changes in the diet can lower blood pressure, according to experts | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsHypertension: Making THESE changes in the diet can lower blood pressure, according to expertsTrendingIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHappy Krishna JanmashtamiKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHappy Krishna JanmashtamiKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHappy Krishna JanmashtamiKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesHypertension: Making THESE changes in the diet can lower blood pressure, according to expertsTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 14:07 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeA recent study highlights the significant benefits of a diet rich in fruits and vegetables for individuals with hypertension. The research demonstrates that incorporating more fruits and vegetables into one's diet can effectively lower blood pressure, improve kidney health, and reduce cardiovascular disease risk. Unlike sodium bicarbonate, fruits and vegetables achieve these benefits while potentially reducing the need for medication. A recent study highlights the significant benefits of a diet rich in fruits and vegetables for individuals with hypertension. The research demonstrates that incorporating more fruits and vegetables into one's diet can effectively lower blood pressure, improve kidney health, and reduce cardiovascular disease risk. Unlike sodium bicarbonate, fruits and vegetables achieve these benefits while potentially reducing the need for medication. High blood pressure, aka hypertension, affects about 1.28 billion adults (aged 30–79) globally. Among these, about 46% are unaware that this condition exists, according to the WHO. High blood pressure is a silent killer and could lead to chronic illnesses, such as heart disease, stroke, and kidney failure. Certain factors increase the risk of hypertension; however, some of them are in our control, and one is diet. A 2024 study found that making certain dietary changes can lower blood pressure and improve kidney and heart health. The findings of the five-year interventional randomized control trial are published in The American Journal of Medicine. Watch what you eatFocusing on a diet that is rich in fruits and vegetables is crucial in the treatment of hypertension patients, according to doctors. Despite efforts, hypertension-related chronic kidney disease and its cardiovascular mortality are increasing. Heart disease is the number one reason that patients with chronic kidney disease die.PollWhich factor do you think has the most significant impact on managing high blood pressure?Healthy diet (fruits & vegetables)MedicationSo what should you eat to lower blood pressure? DASH. Yes, the Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension (DASH) diet, is proven to lower blood pressure. This is a flexible and balanced eating plan, that is rich in fruits and vegetables. It is the recommended first-line treatment for primary hypertension. Despite scientific evidence, the DASH diet is under-prescribed and under-implemented.“As a nephrologist (kidney doctor), my acid-base laboratory studies ways by which the kidney removes acid from the blood and puts it into the urine. Our animal studies showed years ago that mechanisms used by the kidneys to remove acid from the blood can cause kidney injury if the animals were chronically (long-term) exposed to an acid-producing diet. Our patient studies showed similar findings: that is, an acid-producing diet (one high in animal products) was kidney-harmful, and one that is base-producing (one high in fruits and vegetables) is kidney-healthy. Other investigators showed that a diet high in fruits and vegetables is heart-healthy. We hypothesized that one way that fruits and vegetables are both kidney- and heart-healthy is that they reduce the amount of acid in the diet and therefore the amount of acid that kidneys have to remove from the body,” Donald E. Wesson, MD, MBA, lead investigator Department of Internal Medicine, Dell Medical School, The University of Texas at Austin, said, in a statement.The study To test the hypothesis, they conducted a study with participants who had hypertension, but not diabetes, and very high levels of urine albumin excretion (macroalbuminuria). Those with macroalbuminuria have chronic kidney disease, a high risk for the worsening of their kidney disease with time, and a high risk to subsequently developing cardiovascular diseases. The trial took over a five-year period, where the 153 participants with hypertension were divided into three groups:Study participants added 2-4 cups of base-producing fruits and vegetables in addition to their usual daily food intakeStudy participants were prescribed NaHCO3 (acid-reducing sodium bicarbonate, which is common baking soda) tablets in two daily doses of 4-5 650 mg tabletsStudy participants receiving standard medical care from primary care cliniciansHow diet plays a crucial roleThe findings of the study confirmed that consumption of fruits and vegetables and NaHCO3 improved kidney health, but only fruits and vegetables, and not NaHCO3, reduced blood pressure and improved indices of cardiovascular disease risk.“Importantly, fruits and vegetables achieved the latter two benefits with lower doses of medication used to lower blood pressure and reduce cardiovascular disease risk. This means that one can get the kidney health benefits with either fruits and vegetables or NaHCO3, but we get the blood pressure reduction and reduced cardiovascular disease risk with fruits and vegetables, but not with NaHCO3. This supports our recommendation that fruits and vegetables should be ‘foundational’ treatment for patients with hypertension, because we accomplish all three goals (kidney health, lower blood pressure, and reduced cardiovascular disease risk) with fruits and vegetables, and we can do so with lower medication doses,” co-investigator Maninder Kahlon, PhD, Department of Population Health, Dell Medical School, The University of Texas at Austin, explains.Low blood pressure got you down? Try these 4 home fixes!"Dietary interventions for chronic disease management are often not recommended and even less often executed because of the many challenges to get patients to implement them. Nevertheless, they are effective, and in this instance, kidney and cardiovascular protective. We must increase our efforts to incorporate them into patient management and more broadly, make healthy diets more accessible to populations at increased risk for kidney and cardiovascular disease,” Dr. Wesson adds.Get the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Happy Independence Day wishes, messages, and quotes !About the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. Do BP readings differ between arms? Doctor explains what it means
Small blood pressure differences between arms are common, usually under 10 mmHg. However, a consistent difference exceeding 10-15 mmHg warrants medical consultation, potentially indicating artery narrowing or, rarely, aortic dissection. Doctors often check both arms to uncover hidden circulation issues, advising consistent use of the arm with higher readings for future measurements.
Do BP readings differ between arms? Doctor explains what it means | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsDo BP readings differ between arms? Doctor explains what it meansTrendingIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesDo BP readings differ between arms? Doctor explains what it meansTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in /  Aug 15, 2025, 11:39 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSmall blood pressure differences between arms are common, usually under 10 mmHg. However, a consistent difference exceeding 10-15 mmHg warrants medical consultation, potentially indicating artery narrowing or, rarely, aortic dissection. Doctors often check both arms to uncover hidden circulation issues, advising consistent use of the arm with higher readings for future measurements.   You’re sitting in the doctor’s office, they slap the cuff on your right arm, pump it up, and read out your blood pressure. But then they decide to check the left arm too… and wait a minute the numbers don’t match. Cue the little voice in your head: Is something wrong?Let’s talk about why this happens, when it’s totally fine, and when it might be a sign to dig deeper.Yep, it’s normal… sometimesFirst, don’t panic. Small differences in blood pressure between your two arms are actually pretty common. In fact, for most healthy people, it’s normal to see a difference of up to 10 mmHg (that’s millimeters of mercury, the unit for BP).So if your right arm says 122/78 and your left says 128/80, you can probably relax, it’s likely just normal variation.When the difference could mean something moreNow, here’s the important bit, according to Harvard Health, if there’s a consistent difference of more than 10–15 mmHg between your arms, especially in the top (systolic) number, it’s worth talking to your doctor.Larger, ongoing differences can sometimes be linked to:Artery narrowing (Peripheral Artery Disease) – If one arm has a partially blocked artery, it can affect blood flow and pressure readings.Aortic dissection (rare, but serious) – This is a sudden tear in the aorta wall. It’s an emergency and comes with other severe symptoms like chest pain.Recently, Dr Sudhir Kumar took to X to explain this phenomenon. "1. Variation of systolic BP up to 10 mmHg and diastolic BP of up to 5 mmHg between two arms is normal. Always use the higher arm reading for recording. 2. If the inter-arm variation is greater than 15 mmHg, it is NOT normal- could be suggestive of a vascular disease- get evaluated by a doctor," he posted on X.Why doctors sometimes check both armsMedical pros know that arm-to-arm BP differences can reveal hidden circulation issues. That’s why many guidelines suggest measuring both arms at least once during checkups, especially for new patients or anyone at higher cardiovascular risk.If one arm consistently shows higher readings, your doctor might recommend using that arm for all future measurements to keep your numbers consistent.What you can do at homeIf you’ve got a blood pressure monitor at home (and honestly, they’re a great investment if you care about heart health), here’s how to check:Measure both arms – Sit quietly for 5 minutes, then check your BP on one arm, rest for a minute, and check the other.Keep a log – Write down your readings and any noticeable patterns.Talk to your doctor – If the difference is consistently over 10–15 mmHg, bring your log to your next appointment.A small difference in blood pressure between arms? Totally normal. But if you’re seeing a bigger, consistent gap, don’t ignore it—it could be your body’s way of flagging something important.Your arms might look the same on the outside, but the blood vessels inside could be telling two different stories. Checking both arms every once in a while is a simple, quick way to keep an eye on your circulation health.Next time a nurse or doctor checks your BP, you’ll know exactly why they sometimes switch sides. Not because they’re bored… but because your arms might be trying to tell them something.Get the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Happy Independence Day wishes, messages, and quotes !About the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. At the TOI Lifestyle Desk, we go beyond the obvious, delving into the extraordinary. Consider us your lifestyle companion, providing a daily dose of inspiration and information. Whether you're seeking the latest fashion trends, travel escapades, culinary delights, or wellness tips, the TOI Lifestyle Desk is your one-stop destination for an enriching lifestyle experience.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousAshnoor Kaur’s top 10 ultra-glam lookstvRubina Dilaik's powerful reality show lookstvIn pic: Radiant pictures of Pooja HegdeEntertainment5 human body parts we may no longer need in the futureLifestyleBollywood-approved ethnic sets that are perfect for Independence Day 2025Lifestyle10 Stunning ethnic looks of Megha Shettytv10 celeb-inspired Indian baby girl namesLifestyleOne's own enemy: 8 animals that get triggered by their own reflectionLifestyleIndependence Day 2025: 10 inspiring lines on Freedom that warm the heartLifestyleJanmashtami 2025: Ethnic Glam Lessons from Malavika MohananEntertainment Next123 Photostories  9 health benefits of potatoes (backed by science)Janmashtami 2025: 5 diabetes-friendly sweet recipes for Janmashtami bhog50 Years of Thalaivar: Rajinikanth’s iconic movies that fans cherish forever7 workout supplements every fitness enthusiast should know5 simple chia seed recipes that help in weight loss5 foods that can lower the chances of getting a strokeWhy Aarti has 5 flames: The deep meaning behind itIndia at 79: PM Modi leads Independence Day celebrations - Influencers miss flight after ChatGPT advice: The twist will leave you speechless
Couple Mery Caldass and Alejandro Cid faced airport trouble. They were traveling to Puerto Rico. ChatGPT gave them wrong travel advice. It said no visa was needed. But an ESTA was necessary. They missed this detail. The couple got stuck. Another man was hospitalized. He followed AI suggestions. Experts advise caution with AI.
Influencers miss flight after ChatGPT advice: The twist will leave you speechless | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshiptrendingHealth+stylevisual storiesparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior CareNewslifestyletrendingInfluencers miss flight after ChatGPT advice: The twist will leave you speechlessTrendingIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesInfluencers miss flight after ChatGPT advice: The twist will leave you speechlessTOI Trending Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 10:32 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeCouple Mery Caldass and Alejandro Cid faced airport trouble. They were traveling to Puerto Rico. ChatGPT gave them wrong travel advice. It said no visa was needed. But an ESTA was necessary. They missed this detail. The couple got stuck. Another man was hospitalized. He followed AI suggestions. Experts advise caution with AI.   Influencer couple Mery Caldass and Alejandro Cid were all set for what should’ve been a dreamy trip to Puerto Rico. But instead of basking in beach vibes, they ended up stuck in an airport, sobbing and blaming none other than ChatGPT for their nightmare.In a now-viral TikTok with over 13,000 views, as reported by New York Post, Mery with tears streaming, frustration loud and clearly explains that, “I always do tons of research, but I asked ChatGPT and it said no visa was needed.” Which, sure, sounds convenient. But unfortunately, that “advice” missed a tiny, yet crucial detail: while they didn’t need a visa for Puerto Rico, they did need something called an ESTA (Electronic System for Travel Authorization). It’s kind of like a quick online clearance that ChatGPT apparently forgot to mention.Unsurprisingly, the clip lit up the internet. A lot of people had words. Some were with the sarcasm, like commenting, “Natural selection, I guess,” mocking their decision to rely on ChatGPT for something important. Another quipped, “Who trusts ChatGPT for that kind of info?”On the flip side, a few folks defended the AI: maybe the couple just didn’t phrase their question properly, sure, they asked if they needed a visa, but they never asked whether an ESTA was necessary. What is ESTA?The ESTA, short for Electronic System for Travel Authorization, is basically an online permission slip. If you’re from one of the eligible countries, you don’t need a full visa, but you do need to fill out this quick online form before you travel. It’s not a visa interview or a mountain of paperwork, just an application you do online, pay a small fee for, and usually get approved within minutes (though they say apply at least 72 hours before your trip, just in case). Once approved, it’s valid for two years, and you can use it for multiple trips. Think of it as a “fast pass” but skip it, and you might end up like those influencers stuck at the airport instead of sipping piña coladas.Another ChatGPT mishapThis isn’t the only headline-grabbing ChatGPT slip-up lately. Other stories have spotlighted more concerning misadventures: one older guy ended up hospitalized with hallucinations after following AI-generated suggestions. Clearly, when it comes to AI, a healthy dose of skepticism and double-checking is a must.End of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousRubina Dilaik's powerful reality show lookstvIn pic: Radiant pictures of Pooja HegdeEntertainment5 human body parts we may no longer need in the futureLifestyleBollywood-approved ethnic sets that are perfect for Independence Day 2025Lifestyle10 Stunning ethnic looks of Megha Shettytv10 celeb-inspired Indian baby girl namesLifestyleOne's own enemy: 8 animals that get triggered by their own reflectionLifestyleIndependence Day 2025: 10 inspiring lines on Freedom that warm the heartLifestyleJanmashtami 2025: Ethnic Glam Lessons from Malavika MohananEntertainmentHow to build a balcony water garden with easy care stepsLifestyle Next123 Photostories  5 simple chia seed recipes that help in weight loss5 foods that can lower the chances of getting a strokeWhy Aarti has 5 flames: The deep meaning behind itIndia at 79: PM Modi leads Independence Day celebrations - How to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami
How to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami and channel your inner Radha rani

How to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami and channel your inner Radha rani

























 



Home Lifestyle AstrologyWhats CookingRelationshipsStyleArt and CultureGardeningBeauty and CareHealth & Wellness Healthy LivingRecipesInspireTips & TricksBuzzFashion  Beauty & CareCelebrity FashionStyleWorth InvestmentMutual FundsNewsEntertainment BollywoodCelebscoopHollywoodOriginalsBingeExploreTechnologyNewsAppsScience And FutureAutoCurrentElectricAlternateSpecialsFestive Season 2025Treks Of India101 Abu Dhabi DosCreate on IndiaOscars 2024WanderlustAyodhya Ram Mandir #FitITIndia On PlateSummer in Abu Dhabi: Totally RecommendedGive Up PlasticSustainabilityThe Great Indian Brain DrainCareersEventsHow to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami and channel your inner Radha raniHow to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami and channel your inner Radha raniWith Janmashtami around the corner, it is time to perfect your Gopi dress drape for that timeless Radha look. From wrapping a saree as a skirt to styling a dupatta like a queen, here are simple hacks and elegant tricks to make your festive outfit truly unforgettable.Saloni JhaUpdated: Aug 15, 2025, 07:30 IST  4  min read  Janmashtami is tomorrow, August 16th, 2025. And with it comes the perfect excuse to dress up in the most graceful, vibrant attire inspired by Radha herself, the iconic Gopi dress. More than just clothing, it is a celebration of tradition, elegance, and devotion.
How to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami?| Credit: Instagram/chintamanidianaWhether you are attending a temple event, joining a dance performance, or simply soaking in the festive spirit at home, knowing how to drape and style a Gopi dress flawlessly can take your look from pretty to divine.
How to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami?| Credit: Instagram/chintamanidianaHow to wear a perfect gopi dress on Janmasthami on your own?Start with a flowy skirt or repurpose a lightweight saree into a skirt. Opt for fabrics like georgette, chiffon, or cotton that flow beautifully and allow easy movement for dancing and festivities. Add a vibrant petticoat for extra volume, because more twirl means more charm.
View this post on InstagramThe wrap-and-tuck skirt methodIf using a saree, start by tucking one end firmly into your waist and wrap it around until you get a comfortable fit. Secure with a discreet pin to avoid mishaps. For ready-made skirts, choose one with a good flare to mimic that traditional Gopi silhouette.
How to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami?| Credit: Instagram/simpalkharelDupatta draping for the Radha effectDo not simply throw your dupatta over your shoulder. Instead, tuck one end into your skirt at the waist, bring it diagonally across your torso, loop it behind your back, and drape it gracefully over the opposite shoulder. This gives a traditional yet flattering look, echoing classical temple styles.
How to perfectly wear a Gopi dress this Janmashtami?| Credit: Instagram/chintamanidianaPlaying with colours and detailsA Gopi outfit is all about vibrancy. Pair a royal blue skirt with a bright yellow dupatta for a Radha-inspired look, or try deep pink with green for a festive contrast. Embroidery, mirror work, or simple golden borders can instantly make the outfit stand out.
View this post on InstagramAccessories that complete the lookAdd a kamarbandh to define your waist and wear traditional jewellery such as jhumkas, a matha-patti, and payals. Fresh jasmine flowers or gajra around a bun or braid will add a fragrant, graceful touch. Small details make all the difference in transforming your look from simple to divine. And most important, do not forget to do the gopi dots to cimplete the look.
How to do Gopi makeup for Radha inspired look on Janmashtami| Credit: Instagram/mrunuQuick style hacksShort on time? Pre-pleated skirts and stitched dupatta drapes are available online for a hassle-free yet elegant appearance. Just slip into your outfit, add jewellery, and you are ready to join the celebrations without a single pleat out of place.By following these steps, you will not just wear a Gopi dress, you will embody the poise, grace, and devotion of Radha herself this Janmashtami.First Published: Aug 15, 2025, 07:30 ISTSaloni JhaI am your go-to girl for all things entertainment, fashion, and lifestyle. With three years of experience, I have got an eye for spotting trends that’ll leave you craving for more. Whether it’s the latest in fashion or the hottest celebrity gossip, I am is always on top of what’s next—and ready to spill all the tea in the most fun way possible. Countries that also celebrate Independence Day on August 15
August 15 is a significant date for several countries celebrating their Independence Day, marking their liberation from colonial or foreign rule. While India famously celebrates its Independence Day on August 15, several other countries also mark this date to commemorate their liberation. Here are five countries that share this historic date with India.
Countries that also celebrate Independence Day on August 15 Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshiptravelHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newshome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carenewsadventureshotelsthings to dodestinationsNewslifestyletravelCountries that also celebrate Independence Day on August 15TrendingIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesCountries that also celebrate Independence Day on August 15TOI Lifestyle Desk / ETimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 8:32 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/6Countries that also celebrate Independence day on August 15August 15 is a significant date for several countries celebrating their Independence Day, marking their liberation from colonial or foreign rule. While India famously celebrates its Independence Day on August 15, several other countries also mark this date to commemorate their liberation. Here are five countries that share this historic date with India. Each of these countries have their unique story of independence.2/6IndiaIndia celebrates its Independence Day on August 15. The day marks the end of British colonial rule after a long freedom struggle. Flag hoisting ceremony is something you will get to witness plenty on this day. Other activities include parades and cultural events across the nation.3/6South KoreaSouth Korea celebrates Gwangbokjeol on August 15, commemorating the end of Japanese colonial rule in 1945 following Japan’s surrender in World War II. If you happen to be in South Korea right now, make sure to check out official ceremonies and cultural events in Seoul and beyond. Visit South Korea for its rich and unique culture, great sight and even greater culinary experiences.4/6North Korea (DPRK)5/6Republic of the CongoThe Republic of the Congo also celebrates its Independence Day on August 15, commemorating its independence from French colonial rule in 1960. Festivities include parades and cultural displays, particularly in Brazzaville. The country's tropical rainforest is home to several rare and exotic wildlife species.6/6LiechtensteinLiechtenstein celebrates its National Day on August 15, formalized in 1940, commemorating its independence from the German Confederation in 1866. The day includes public festivities, speeches, and fireworks in Vaduz, often tied to the Prince’s birthday celebrations. Liechtenstein is located between Switzerland and Austria, and the views are simply out of this world.Follow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous5 early signs that one's nervous system is Improve heart health, liver function, cholesterol, and more: 7 powerful health benefits of hibiscus tea
Hibiscus tea, derived from the vibrant Hibiscus sabdariffa, offers a range of potential health benefits. Rich in antioxidants, it may lower blood pressure, support healthy blood fat levels, and promote liver health. Studies suggest it could aid weight loss, possess anti-cancer properties, and reduce bacterial growth, making it a flavorful and healthful addition to one's diet.
Improve heart health, liver function, cholesterol, and more: 7 powerful health benefits of hibiscus tea | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsImprove heart health, liver function, cholesterol, and more: 7 powerful health benefits of hibiscus teaTrendingIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesImprove heart health, liver function, cholesterol, and more: 7 powerful health benefits of hibiscus teaTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 10:51 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHibiscus tea, derived from the vibrant Hibiscus sabdariffa, offers a range of potential health benefits. Rich in antioxidants, it may lower blood pressure, support healthy blood fat levels, and promote liver health. Studies suggest it could aid weight loss, possess anti-cancer properties, and reduce bacterial growth, making it a flavorful and healthful addition to one's diet.  Hibiscus, a vibrant flowering plant, is widely known for its antioxidant-rich properties and potential health benefits. Most commonly consumed as hibiscus tea, it has been linked to weight loss, heart health, liver support, antibacterial activity, and even cancer prevention. With a tart, cranberry-like flavor, hibiscus tea can be enjoyed hot or cold and is made by steeping the dried flowers or extracts in boiling water. Among the many species, Hibiscus sabdariffa is the most popular for tea preparation. This article explores eight key benefits of hibiscus, including its nutritional properties, impact on chronic diseases, and tips for making and enjoying hibiscus tea.5 Things that show you have a healthy heartBenefits of consuming Hibiscus teaRich in antioxidantsHibiscus is packed with antioxidants, which are compounds that neutralize harmful free radicals in the body. Free radicals can cause cell damage, inflammation, and contribute to chronic diseases. As per the study published in PubMed, people with Marfan syndrome reported that hibiscus extract improved blood antioxidant levels.Animal research also demonstrated protection against cellular damage.Human and animal studies have shown that hibiscus extract increases antioxidant levels and reduces oxidative stress.May lower blood pressureOne of the most well-known benefits of hibiscus tea is its potential to reduce high blood pressure, a key risk factor for heart disease. Studies have shown that hibiscus tea may lower both systolic and diastolic blood pressure. A study with 46 participants found that consuming hibiscus tea for one month significantly reduced blood pressure compared to a placebo. As per the study published in PubMed, the health benefits of consuming hibiscus tea may help you prevent various heart issues and control blood pressure. Caution: People taking blood pressure medications should consult a doctor before consuming hibiscus tea to avoid interactions.Supports healthy blood fat levelsHibiscus tea may also improve cholesterol and triglyceride levels, which are critical for heart health. In diabetic participants, hibiscus tea increased HDL (good) cholesterol and reduced LDL (bad) cholesterol and triglycerides.Some studies in people with metabolic syndrome showed similar results, though research in healthy populations is limited.Conflicting evidence exists, so more large-scale studies are needed.Promotes liver healthThe liver performs essential functions, including fat metabolism, protein synthesis, and detoxification. Hibiscus may support liver function by:Reducing liver fat accumulation (steatosis) in overweight individuals.Protecting liver cells from damage in animal studies.Improving markers of fatty liver disease in high-fat diet animal models.According to various studies, hibiscus tea is involved in supporting liver function. May aid weight lossHibiscus tea may support weight management and fat reduction:Studies with overweight participants consuming hibiscus extract reported decreases in body weight, body fat, BMI, and waist-to-hip ratio.Animal studies suggest hibiscus may reduce fat accumulation and suppress appetite.Potential anti-cancer propertiesHibiscus is rich in polyphenols, compounds known for anticancer activity:Test-tube studies show hibiscus extract can inhibit the growth and spread of cancer cells, including breast, prostate, mouth, and skin cancers. These studies involve concentrated extracts, not the tea form, so human effects remain unproven.May reduce bacterial growthHibiscus may help combat harmful bacteria:Test-tube studies show hibiscus extract inhibits strains like E. coli, and other bacteria linked to infections such as pneumonia and urinary tract infections.Extracts have shown activity comparable to certain antibiotics in lab studies.How to prepare hibiscus tea and deliciousHibiscus tea is simple to make and enjoyable:Add dried hibiscus flowers to boiling water, steep for 5 minutes, strain, and optionally sweeten with honey or lime juice. It can be served hot or cold, offering a tart, cranberry-like flavour.Dried hibiscus is widely available in health stores and online, and tea bags provide a convenient alternative.How to add hibiscus tea into your dietHibiscus tea is simple to make and enjoyable:Preparation: Add dried hibiscus flowers to boiling water, steep for 5 minutes, strain, and optionally sweeten with honey or lime juice.Serving: It can be served hot or cold, offering a tart, cranberry-like flavor.Availability: Dried hibiscus is widely available in health stores and online, and tea bags provide a convenient alternative.Disclaimer: The information provided is for educational purposes only. Hibiscus tea may offer health benefits, but it is not a substitute for medical advice. Consult your doctor before use.Also Read | Stop eating more than twice a day:Cardiologist warns about alcohol, non-stick pans, hidden heart risks and other tips to preventGet the latest lifestyle updates on Times of India, along with Happy Independence Day wishes, messages, and quotes !About the AuthorTOI Lifestyle DeskThe TOI Lifestyle Desk is a dynamic team of dedicated journalists who, with unwavering passion and commitment, sift through the pulse of the nation to curate a vibrant tapestry of lifestyle news for The Times of India readers. 4 powerful food pairings to maximize nutrition
Enhance your nutrient absorption and gut health by pairing specific foods. Combining spinach with citrus boosts iron bioavailability, while tomatoes and olive oil maximize lycopene absorption. Garlic and honey preserve allicin's benefits, and turmeric with black pepper dramatically increases curcumin absorption, optimizing your diet's nutritional value.
Eat smarter: 4 powerful food pairings approved by a gastroenterologist to maximize nutrition | - Times of India Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-newsEat smarter: 4 powerful food pairings approved by a gastroenterologist to maximize nutritionTrendingIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesEat smarter: 4 powerful food pairings approved by a gastroenterologist to maximize nutritionTOI Lifestyle Desk / etimes.in / Updated: Aug 15, 2025, 12:07 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLarge AI-generated audio summary; not verified by the edit team.Enhance your nutrient absorption and gut health by pairing specific foods. Combining spinach with citrus boosts iron bioavailability, while tomatoes and olive oil maximize lycopene absorption. Garlic and honey preserve allicin's benefits, and turmeric with black pepper dramatically increases curcumin absorption, optimizing your diet's nutritional value.  Your health and wellness start with what you eat. Eating healthy is, however, not just about what you eat, but how you eat. While diet plays a crucial role in your well-being, the way you combine, prepare, and enjoy it is of paramount importance. Pairing certain foods with others can boost nutrition. Dr. Will Bulsiewicz, a leading gastroenterologist and gut health expert, has shared four powerful food pairings that will help you absorb more nutrients and improve gut health. Let’s take a look. Beat belly fat with millets: Easy breakfast ideas for quick weight lossSpinach and citrusSpinach, as we all know, is an excellent source of iron. But spinach has non-heme iron, which is a form of iron that the body cannot absorb efficiently when compared to heme iron from animal sources. So how do you increase its bioavailability? Dr. Bulsiewicz suggests adding citrus to it. “When you add a source of vitamin C to spinach, like a squeeze of lemon or some orange segments, it transforms the iron in spinach into a more bioavailable form, helping boost your energy and prevent iron deficiency,” the gut doctor explains.Tomatoes and olive oilEver wondered why your Nonna Pia adds olive oil to sauté the tomatoes? Well, it's more than just amping up the flavour. The generational knowledge passed down to her is rooted in science! Tomatoes contain lycopene, which is a fat-soluble antioxidant compound that reduces the risk of heart disease by slashing oxidative stress. “But it's not that easy to absorb until you combine it with extra virgin olive oil. The fat from the extra virgin olive oil actually helps you to get more of the lycopene from the tomatoes,” the doctor adds. Danielle Spencer’s Final Days: Her Mother Speaks on Her Gastric Cancer Battle | WATCHGarlic and honeyCombining honey with garlic may not appear very appetizing, but this pairing has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits. “Garlic has these sulfur-containing compounds called allicin. Allicin is so good for us. But the problem is, it breaks down very quickly,” Dr. Bulsiewicz says. The best way to preserve the benefits of garlic is to add honey to it. “If you add raw honey, it can actually help to preserve the allicin while also offering its own benefits for your immune system and your gut health,” the doctor reveals. Turmeric and black pepperTurmeric and black pepper are indeed a match made in heaven! Turmeric contains a compound called curcumin, which has anti-inflammatory properties. However, it’s poorly absorbed on its own. “Turmeric is a wonderful spice and curry that has these powerful anti-inflammatory polyphenols called curcumin. The problem is, curcumin is not absorbed very easily. But what you could do is combine this with black pepper, which has piperine,” the doctor says. When you add black pepper to turmeric, its bioavailability increases by up to 2,000%. Yes, that’s indeed a dramatic boost. “These combinations aren’t gimmicks. They’re simple, evidence-based strategies to help you get more from the foods you already enjoy,” he adds. 5 foods that can lower the chances of getting a stroke
5 foods that can lower the chances of getting a stroke
5 foods that can lower the chances of getting a stroke Sign InTOIGo toTOIEtimeshomelifestylerelationshipHealth+stylevisual storiestrendingparentingSenior Livingthe artssoul searchbeautybooksrecipesfood newstravelhome & gardeneventsspotlightvideosSenior Carehealth newsfitnessdietmental healthcoronavirusalternative therapiesweight lossvideosdiseasesyogaNewslifestylehealth-fitnesshealth-news5 foods that can lower the chances of getting a strokeTrendingIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate CountriesIndependence Day MessagesIndependence Day 2025Lower Blood SugarLiver Disease SymptomsDual Task ExerciseHigh Cholesterol SymptomsHeart AttackKidney Damage SymptomsGut HealthHighest Inflation Rate Countries5 foods that can lower the chances of getting a strokeETimes.in /  Aug 15, 2025, 10:00 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFollow us 1/65 foods that can lower the chances of getting a strokeA stroke is a medical emergency, that occurs when there is a loss of blood flow to part of the brain. Your brain are unable to get oxygen and nutrients they need from blood, and start to die within a few minutes. This can cause lasting brain damage, long-term disability, or even death. Stroke can be caused by a variety of factors including High Blood Pressure, smoking, diabetes, and poor diet. However, certain foods provide cardiovascular benefits which help decrease blood pressure while fighting inflammation. The following five foods can decrease your chances of experiencing a stroke.... Take a look...2/6Leafy green vegetablesLeafy greens consisting of spinach, kale, collard greens etc provide brain and heart protection through their essential nutritional value. Your body transforms dietary nitrates from leafy greens into the beneficial compound nitric oxide. The production of nitric oxide results in blood vessel relaxation and expansion, which enhances blood flow while decreasing blood pressure levels. Stroke prevention becomes more likely through the consumption of leafy greens because high blood pressure remains a significant risk factor for stroke. The nutritional elements in these vegetables help protect blood vessels through their vitamin content and antioxidant properties, which fight dangerous molecules in the body. A person who consumes one cup of leafy greens each day will experience decreased chances of developing ischemic stroke, that occurs because of clots obstructing brain blood flow.3/6Walnuts and other nutsThe heart and brain benefits of walnuts, stem from their content of alpha-linolenic acid (ALA) which belongs to the omega-3 fatty acid family. Omega-3s in the body create anti-inflammatory effects, which enhance blood circulation and decrease blood pressure levels to minimise stroke occurrence. Walnuts contain protective antioxidants which shield the body from oxidative stress, by protecting its cells and blood vessels. Scientific research indicates walnuts consumed on a regular basis, help decrease both heart disease and stroke risks. Daily consumption of a handful of walnuts along with almonds and flaxseeds, maintains your vascular system.4/6Citrus fruitsVitamin C along with potassium and flavonoids from citrus fruits like oranges, grapefruits and lemons, provide antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties. The nutrients in these foods work to preserve healthy blood vessels while decreasing inflammation, which leads to damage and blockages. Studies prove that eating citrus fruits regularly decreases stroke risk through improved blood vessel function, together with lowered blood pressure. Eating different citrus fruits each day through natural juice consumption provides these health benefits.5/6Fatty FishSalmon, mackerel, trout and fresh tuna among other fatty fish varieties are rich in omega-3 fatty acids. The healthy fats in these foods decrease blood pressure, while simultaneously fighting inflammation and improving cholesterol numbers through increased good HDL cholesterol and decreased bad LDL cholesterol. These beneficial outcomes decrease the probability of blood clots that block brain blood flow. Medical professionals advise patients to consume fatty fish twice to three times weekly, to prevent stroke. You can prepare these fish by grilling or baking them, and using them in salads and pasta dishes.6/6Yogurt and low-fat dairy productsYogurt, alongside other low-fat dairy products supply the body with calcium, potassium, protein and vitamin D. The body maintains healthy blood pressure through potassium, which regulates sodium levels. Healthy blood vessels together with strong bones, receive support from calcium and vitamin D. Selecting low-fat or non-fat dairy alternatives instead of full-fat versions, enables people to minimise their intake of saturated fat and cholesterol, which can negatively impact heart health. Research indicates that regular yogurt consumption leads to lower probabilities of developing stroke and heart disease. Yogurt serves as a snack that can be combined with fresh fruit and whole grains during breakfast time.Sourceshttps://www.healthline.com/health/stroke/foods-that-prevent-strokehttps://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC6047334/https://continentalhospitals.com/blog/10-foods-to-add-to-your-diet-that-help-prevent-stroke/https://www.health.harvard.edu/womens-health/8-things-you-can-do-to-prevent-a-strokehttps://www.geisinger.org/health-and-wellness/wellness-articles/2018/05/08/13/47/these-brain-foods-could-cut-your-risk-of-strokeDisclaimer: This article is informational only and not a substitute for medical adviceFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous10 must-try South Indian Paneer dishesFood5 early signs that one's nervous
